column3: Candlewood Suites Las Vegas - E Tropicana by IHG
column5: 185 E Tropicana Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89103
column18: Relaxed quarters with kitchens in an unpretentious all-suite hotel offering an outdoor pool & a gym.
column29: {"id":"112561116937259055581","name":"Candlewood Suites Las Vegas - E Tropicana by IHG (Owner)","link":"https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/112561116937259055581"}
column31: [{"id":"crowd","name":"Crowd","options":[{"name":"LGBTQ+ friendly","enabled":true}]}]
column32:
[{"Name":"alana miller","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX9JLjllCsPa1_53u2y1QEgIBSWgO1AnAUY4GKpeKSRyop750k=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"What a wonderful hotel!  You get a suite, not just a room. It is a 1 bedroom apartment. Living room, bedroom, nice kitchenette and large bathroom!  TV in both the bedroom and living room.  The kitchen has dishes, etc so if you would like to save money and cook, you have can easily do that. The bed was very comfortable. It was very clean.  They are close to the strip so you can walk if you want to.  (I put in almost 20,000 steps the first day) It is also near public transportation, the monorail has a stop right across the street at the MGM Grand.

The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful.  There is a Dennys 2 doors down for 24 hour food.  THey have a pool, exercise room and laundry facilities. They also have a small store there with foods, snacks and drinks.

I had never stayed with them before but I know if I am in vegas again, I sure will stay there again.  I was impressed with them.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Karen Best","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWoi8Jiv8UZCbVxGSy8Lm3M929H-IzdT64CK4emnIb-Hs3hMv8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Quieter than most of the locations on or near the strip. The bluegreen timeshare is really noisy with air traffic, but candlewood is actually pretty quiet. Great little place for your pup to relieve themselves.
Staff was super nice. Great jumping off point for the strip with the MGM monorail literally across the street.
Beware of the parking sharks. I must have been checking in, getting my bearings, was in a spot with no pay sign in front....this is a shared parking lot. it's a joke. Metropolis is who collects the money not the hotel. Anyway, I had a guest certificate and was told it was included. The manager was nice to take care of it, which is a plus. Some managers you never see or they just don't care after being in the business for 4-5 years.
The kitchenette was adequately stocked. Only thing really missing was a flipper for pancakes and eggs, but we made it work.
Hot tub was a little cool, I'm sure when Vegas is 90+ it's ok. The bbq and pool areas all were well kept.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"192mairar","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QeWB0GIG9gGd6g9zDFXwjE9TRuKRtAO6HvwA5jEdK_CrOJXcVxp8esjQRYTFMjay2JK=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My partner and I visited the Candlewood Suites for the yearly Formula 1 Gran Prix. The location was pretty close to the strip and fairly close to the actual track. We had to take the mono trail to get there after a short walking distance, but so did multiple people from other hotels (and for a better price). Essentially, you could either walk and catch the mono trail or pay for parking near by. The atmosphere was excellent, all the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was very spacious and squeaky clean. My partner and I had no complaints at all about noise, it was very quiet and calm. The TV could have had more channels but it had the most common channels so I wasn‚Äôt too upset about it. Overall, our stay was superb.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Katrina Salinas","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJmA-T_daErCu_9aMfEhGGyFVS3m-n07PF1olM217z3lTcak84E=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Our fight was canceled and we needed a room quickly and late at night.. as an IHG member I found this place and use points and I could not be happier we got the best night's sleep that we had in Vegas. The stuff was so helpful and really friendly.
I was able to do a free load of laundry and come home with clean clothes. It was very close to the airport which was really helpful because we hadn't planned for an extra day in Las Vegas.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Pablo Lopez","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVHEAqNvyKDCEytA9xHzSagrQlPpp1MF-fyNcrhkZ3xvnDtTRnP4Q=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Check in went smoothly, the front desk person was pretty nice and was friendly. The room was very big and had everything I needed for a quick one day stay. Dishwasher, stovetop, fridge, dishes, pots, pans, cups, plates, ice maker in the freezer... lol

Bed was super comfy, i slept pretty darn good. The hotel is obviously close to the airport, so you're gonna hear some airport noise. Aside from that, one of the biggest cons was the 20 dollar a night parking for my rental car. I didn't like that at all. I didnt use the pool, but it looks nice. Hotel has a fitness room, it looked nice from when i walked past it. The strip is kinda far away, so no walking unless you're daring. Noise at night was 3/5'ish, i always bring earplugs so i was dandy. Hope this review helps.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Roxy 7.0","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK4CSiPSz-9xddVoXA8hul9evG1fDUcq5qoQwhUu07zMSlK3g=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Great location close to the strip but not on it letting you have a quieter and more restful sleep. Parking lot directly next to bldg so no complicated or drawn out process like in bigger hotels. Room was spacious and everything was very clean and tidy. The free laundry was really appreciated. If you want a basic and comfortable stay with updated rooms and great location this is perfect. Room was quite big.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"antonio muy","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKfNNKl_qAEMAIbzKnUbFMT9UPgSqsKsn8KrBTTrykKpk8a1w=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"I have stayed here before for just one or two nights, but this time I had to stay for six days. The rooms are nice and clean; my only big disappointment was that even though it's listed on the paper to let them know about room service 24 hours ahead, which I did; when I came back from work expecting a clean room with towels, nothing was done... that was Tuesday, then I had to go and talk to the guy at the front desk, and I thought it wasn't a big deal... just put a request for tomorrow... to my surprise, I got back and no service was done. Once again, I went and talked to the housekeeping manager, (not the general manager) and I asked her what was going on, why my room wasn't cleaned when I requested the service, and the first thing she tried to say was, "Did you request housekeeping within 24 hours?" I was like yes more than that, and her answer was simple... I don't know what happened!!! I was like who knows you are the manager, this is not ok... it's the second time I have to ask for room service... she offered to clean my room that day, I denied the service. I said no, I need to sleep and I don't need towels, I already went and got some myself... bad experience.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"D Valenzuela-Garcia","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUcD4TopQIEVSSnEBYQYVtq0rAStxwNmcwl5hHfPaPYqrJWQYXs=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Candlewood Suites is a nice place overall the rooms are comfortable, and I appreciate that they have Tesla chargers available. Like any Tesla charger, there‚Äôs a fee per kilowatt, which is fine.

However, the management here is a mess, to say the least, and definitely not very customer-service oriented. I had checked out earlier in the day, ran a couple of errands, and realized I needed to charge my car, so I returned to the hotel I had just stayed at and hooked up to one of their chargers. I was actively paying for the electricity used.

A staff member eventually came out, circled my car a few times, and then told me I wasn‚Äôt a guest and therefore wasn‚Äôt supposed to use the chargers. But I was a guest earlier that same morning, and nowhere around the charging stations does it clearly say ‚Äúfor guests only.‚Äù The whole interaction felt unnecessary and almost like profiling.

This experience left a really bad taste in my mouth. Between the unclear policies and poor management, I honestly would choose to stay somewhere else‚ÄîMotel 6, for example‚Äîbefore I ever return here. It‚Äôs unfortunate because the location itself is nice, but the management completely undermines the experience.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDYf9ZohuFQeAg-7FP8PR5_&fid=0x0:0xf9335e7d4f47acae"],"When":"2025-10-22"}]

column5: 1236 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89104
column18: Bare-bones dorms & private rooms, plus a communal kitchen, a yoga room & a movie room.
column31: null
column32:
[{"Name":"Elizabeth Perez","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXXsDxk8u_BAYv-VH44qm6YfOdoPh8kMlJDcGEkNNA9TCfeb1M=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Every time I‚Äôm in Vegas I stay at a hidden place behind the Stratosphere it‚Äôs a twin bed with a curtain shared room with same Gender or mix. U buy ur own food at a nearby grocery called Albertsons and u label ur bags with ur name and ur date of checkout. There are lockers so bring ur own lock. And ur own nice long towel for there towels can be used for a shower Matt. The price is worth a nice sleep. Bring ur own sheets and pillow cases to put over there‚Äôs. What this place needs is Goodwill/Salvation army kitchen appliances. A nice large microwave, a nice toaster, and forks and good cutting knives and plates and bowls. Asside from this it‚Äôs totally a money saver what I don‚Äôt like are locals staying there. At check-in I saw women who looked like they were street women on a corner and men who looked homeless. I‚Äôm hoping when I return in May of 2026 not to see these shady characters. I just want to feel safe when I visit for a weekend from Texas.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"jean o","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVAXQm-txVuPxSTaLwp4KEUYMEBHnsxVDDd4Q5PUk-Stdf-nVMR=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"This is my reviow as a solo female traveler. Ive been in many hostels around the world - from the cheapest to the more expensive.

bungalows is the cheapest in Vegas. It checks all the boxes for a hostel. Its clean, well organized, and it feels safe! Theres a big common area outside where you can hang out.

I spent some time walking around the area on a friday night. I did feel safe on the streets. Just have to have your street smarts about you. Be aware of your surroundings, keep your belongings close to you. It‚Äôs all well lit around you. Yes there are homeless people, but they keep to themselves.

Overall I do enjoy staying here and would be happy to come again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Sean Hawes","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW7ULPOpQt8gOucdDtx9a3P_tLO1LpPgtRucx_6MgP5wsThSZ9fOw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Okay here is the deal !! I am reading reviews that sound like snot nose kids who have no idea what they rented. As a world traveler I understand the word H-O-S-T-E-L and these entitled reviewers are all wrong that down this place. Here is the real about this spot.
1. This is the lowest priced opportunity for those visiting Vegas
2. This is a shared living environment (Like OMG really!?? ) yeah really ! If you want privacy pay 35 dollars more a night elsewhere üôÑ
3. This place has the friendliest staff I have ever encountered in a Hostel stay ( Try Germany and see what I mean üò±üòÇ ) they even allow you to stay on property till 9pm the day of check out giving you an opportunity to get your next steps put together.
4. There is a great kitchen and community center with many refrigerators to use. No one bothers your stuff as there are cameras everywhere.The TV room usually has a great movie on and good people to watch with.
5. As if you need any more reasons it is simple, if your on a budget and looking for a safe and chill place to stay it is here if you keep an open mind. This is my go to spot in Vegas as I tried all the others and for price and what you get Bungalow Hostel is your choice. I promise if you try it once you will understand 1 through 4 üòâ

Truth üôå","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"James D'Angelo","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJFPbp66jlxeFOkDbmhBg3QxkazY60KqyEaGbiBWvwAikoCAA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The Bungalows Hostel (formerly Hostel Cat) is a vibrant, community-driven oasis in Las Vegas‚Äô Arts District, offering a safe, welcoming environment for travelers to connect, grow, and thrive amid the city‚Äôs energy. With renovated rooms, engaging daily events, and caring staff fostering genuine friendships, it‚Äôs the ideal spot for honorable guests seeking authentic experiences over luxury isolation. Highly recommended for building lasting memories & enhancing your grind
‚Äîbook now and join the family! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jordan Hersh","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUbFIYcLfRxY1WJIzeu6Uud-PSdWSWXcKRBAPtRsfWtAg1juRvtHA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"The experience was ok. The staff were very friendly.

They give you a fitted sheet, a top sheet, and a towel, but no blanket. There is no mention of needing to bring your own on the website and they keep the air conditioning very cold. There is not a hand towel or any paper towels in the bathroom.

The facilities themselves are fine for a hostel, and the common area is very pleasant. I found everyone I ran into to be very friendly. Do be aware that it‚Äôs a pretty loud neighborhood. Definitely worth bringing noise cancelling headphones.

It‚Äôs about a two minute walk to the Deuce bus, so very accessible to the strip.

I don‚Äôt know that I would stay here again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Pat Lon","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW1R-kOvXF168h0EMfYWAH_TmCRh7Xssb-KsuAeZMQwslPPlNtx=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I really enjoyed the Bungalow Hostal..why? bed, the people (staff and other visitors) included. I really enjoyed the courtyard (it's beautiful, cozy. clean and lots of fun)  also there was guest chef by the name of Bam, his food was delicious.  I will definitely be back.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Miguel Dias","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJh-9N9d-il1nSHKARcYLEN0njaN1MS6MNRDODiSpjeNFMUj1Q=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"I think this is a very good place to stay. Especially if you‚Äôre traveling on a budget or just passing through. Whatever the case may be everybody. There is very kind and inclusive and invites you to movie night and barbecue rather events they have, and someone‚Äôs always cooking bringing food to the table, or going on outings together. People talk about the neighborhood. Not being the best, but it‚Äôs fairly safe and anytime of day or night. As long as you‚Äôre not looking for trouble, and the rooms are fairly clean. Maybe not as luxurious as someone would want, but if that‚Äôs the case, then elsewhere, and you could find it at a much higher price than this personalexperience. I think this is like a community, and everybody gets treated like friends or family, and all the staff. There‚Äôs very kind and helpful and understanding.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Syed Haider","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUlJhQhCz7z-SIRn8VFeEdcF8kYLYqI6IpQOsCGEj4sw8rwrpm2cQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Mid hostel, they dont even change the sheets for you and you have to do everything on your own. Checkin closes at night and I had to get another hotel for 1 night cause my flight was delayed and nobody was at reception.
Unless you're gonna just sleep here for 6 hours a day, I recommend booking something else. It is cheap tho so ig depends on whatchu want.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 1215 S Las Vegas Blvd B, Las Vegas, NV 89104
column18: Funky dorms with TVs & coffeemakers in a trendy hostel offering an outdoor pool & a cocktail bar.
column30: {"borough":"Downtown South","street":"1215 S Las Vegas Blvd B","city":"Las Vegas","postal_code":"89104","state":"Nevada","country":"US"}
column31: null
column32:
[{"Name":"Jeong Ko","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUziboQj7TcpQDP6fDRirYYxVrhm2O_Jk-Kt_u3IasdT3OhHrHWSg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Clean rooms! I observed the Cleaner clean the bathroom and my room thoroughly! Location is great  but some homeless people around the liquor store area. Nice towel, bottle of water and a bar of soap at check in.

When I arrived at check in around 6 PM,  no one was present at the hostel lobby with the windows shut. I tried calling the phone number listed on my reservation but no one picked up. Luckily a guest told me to go to the Super 8 Lobby to check in which was at the next building over. Why was their no sign advising guests to go to the super 8 lobby? The owner and manager don‚Äôt see this as a problem? I saw another guest also looking for check in that night and I was able to guide them to the Super 8 Lobby. Unbelievable they didn‚Äôt think of this as being a problem for customer.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jeff Frey","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUsBKRSPsZ1Vh3d7QAu_jeMFZYUgtizqTikYmRmvyk7N5jBJaL8=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Was a good experience. Great price, room mates were respectful and quite. No complaints here. 4 Star for the room due to the locker setup. Normal metal or wooden free standing lockers but here plastic with the top bunk hanging off the end of the bed so at times the lower bunk might get disturbed at 2 in the morning if someone needs to retrieve something. No biggie though, I've had bigger issues with things at other hostels. Over all, well worth it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Bean Nguyen","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJnoLNdnnb1_vhow2rQBGMmCG6xxy6gAIEbzus-klezlDulYw=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"Should have been 1 star but 2 becos:
The staffs from the hotel (Thunderbird and Super8) and your Bposhels call center are friendly and extremely helpful. Thats an extra star from me. The booking process is the problem. When I booked room from the the third party, it does not show if it is only shared room or not. It gave us option to book private room, when I checked in, the staffs told me there are only shared rooms for Bposhtels booking. I was not happy with that. If you partner with the third party booking, they or you must address that you only offer shared rooms. I was extremely unhappy sharing my private space with other people. I even offer to pay the mark up to get my own room but all rooms were full booked at that time. how unfortunate! I will never go back to your hostel.

And the reservation procedure is a pain, or cancer tbh, cos my friend booked it for me under his name, he was willing to video call and do anything like offer to email his id to show his eligibility so i can get booked. The staffs couldnt do anything cos he had to be physically presented to check in which is very inconvenient to us. I know other hotel's, not hostel since this is my first time booking hostel, procedure is not that strict, they are willing to verify and be flexible. I had 3 other people/families that night facing the same problem as me and they were upset too. One is like me and another one is the different between their real name and English name. The call center was 24/7 but my case wasnt solved until the next morning which i must pay extra to get a temporary stay at the private room assuming i would get a private room after my case was solved without knowing i would get a shared room unless i googled or confirmed with that staff. How many people would do that? It almost ruins my whole trip and really stressed me out. I lost 1 night and my private room just becos your procedure sucks. I called Priceline for compesation but couldnt cancel becos other reasonable hotels were also fully booked. And i wish i could afford to stay at luxury hotels.

And really? 6 people living in the tiny room. i was thinking 4 should be already crowded but 6. I know you want to maximum the profit but that is too much. Too greedy! It is like crush hour in the morning and night since we had to take turn to use the restroom, wasting our time just to wait for our turn instead of using that time for our traveling. I couldnt use the shower or sink at all during my stay and during our rush hour. I went to the airport and had clean up since i did not want to miss my departure flight. Too much, i really mean it, too much traffic in the room during rush hour.

Lesson learnt, I rather book a real hotel which is also not to high compared to your price. I know some hostels offer private rooms too, the price is more reasonable, only a couple dollar higher.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Susan Branum","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJZpmF2sQUyatHdBmSjGR1BPuOsVD9KJSnyn89BVHdr60n-eQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Clean rooms, upgraded bathroom and shower, good comfortable bedding, privacy curtains, secure. Just very cramped, only about 1 foot space between the beds, and no where to keep a suitcase or open it comfortably. Also, no ‚Äúcommon area‚Äù  for travelers to meet and chat etc (other than the pool area). No kitchen or cooking facilities. But it‚Äôs on the ‚Äústrip!‚Äù It‚Äôs definitely Vegas and 24 hour bus line is nearby. $8 for 24 hours. Great hostel and a great price! Definitely worth it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ronaldo Reis FS","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVS-tKMBQc9Dk66XMXVFpBuRJhbRT4TMm2TxAsTzL5zS7biPSas=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The infrastructure is good, the rooms, parking, tech, etc. However, their greater asset is their personnel. The ladies at the front desk, the house keepers, they are very friendly, and they are not shy to show off their customer skills! Specially the housekeepers, it's a very tough work they do, yet, they are doing it happily, they smile, they are humble, just greatful and good people. I can tell the place has been well managed.

PS. In hostels, you will find all walks of life people, its a "melting pot."","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Nathaniel Penaranda","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUak4I3a4hfg_Z-w2Uwe53sqd94gg2DTjQc647sdYwN08hccOI=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"it was my first experience staying at a hostel. and i'm glad it was here. the other guests were great company, the location was perfect. and i had lots of fun. will definitely look to coming back here if i need to in the future","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"RONALD HUGHES","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVFNj-SUqLyLSxcNzFzBu6NPTk-o3ws3bPlL6fF8TpqRztjaTlJ=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The attending staff were convivial, congenial, professional, and polite. The lobby attendant was very kind and I settled in quite comfortably. The quiet, shaded trees with ambient bird sounds abounding is soothing to the senses. Perfect getaway.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Edsel Bester","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIjs2RYIJ0FhjyAUafNa_BqlFcyd8Dby_i27kUZ1VRM9-9-LQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Great hostel, but not exempt of the problems that come with any other hostel (e.g. crazy roommates). At least it is nice and clean, which is important. Ideally, they would have free breakfast and laundry services, but you can‚Äôt get everything for a bargain. Overall good experience.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 1208 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89104
column18: En suite bathrooms in modern dorm rooms, plus freebies like Wi-Fi, breakfast weekly BBQs.
column31: [{"id":"crowd","name":"Crowd","options":[{"name":"LGBTQ+ friendly","enabled":true}]}]
column32:
[{"Name":"Tell Double","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXE9517Jk3EU65tTKaZtbxfLpTamxCICQ9zS-K12Wf2IWCqBO8=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê BEST HOSTEL IN LAS VEGAS!!!!

I had an amazing stay at Sin City Hostel ‚Äî truly five stars all around! The staff here is extremely friendly, polite, and helpful, and the energy is just great. The rooms were clean and spacious, with daily housekeeping keeping everything fresh. Bathrooms were always clean and well maintained.

I loved the security of the code-locked doors and the cozy patio area outside ‚Äî nice, green, and peaceful. The common area was perfect for getting work done, with a big-screen TV and plenty of space to relax. Quiet hours were respected, which made it easy to rest and stay focused.

The free breakfast was delicious every morning and a great way to start the day. Overall, everything was smooth, comfortable, and well-run. I got a lot of my event work done here in a quiet and productive environment.

Great people, great staff, and a great hostel. Highly recommend ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be returning! üåê‚ú®

‚∏ª Martell Edwards  @Telldouble
Telldouble Productions

‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®
‚ú®‚òÅÔ∏èDream B.I.G.‚òÅÔ∏è ‚Ñ¢Ô∏è ‚ú®
‚ú®(BELIEVE IN GOD)       ‚ú® ‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú® ‚ú®.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"jt","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKg5DOn5w4Z2mJanbJQk8gpydnNUqPCEBk1uU3LeowXy6C8pw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"At first I didn't like how there's only one bathroom in each room (completely not soundproof) and the beds without curtains.
BUT this hostel had an amazing breakfast (toast, fruits, and yogurt) and free events. Everyday there is a walking tour led by Michael where you get to gamble with free money and you learn about Las Vegas history and unique places in Fremont Street. By staying at this hostel, you also get free access to nightclubs (with famous DJs) you otherwise would have had to pay for. This place is the best for solo-travelers of all ages to meet new people, and gives you an experience MORE than what you paid for. Thank you to all the friendly staff that made my stay here!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXKQboTinNUr5_UxySAF5siZaAJT0s2A92djjxWOM3gBZKSbEz1=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Exactly what you expect but better. The rooms were clean and spacious. My junk was very comfortable. The location of the hostel was great! Located in the art district which is the center between The Strip and Downtown (Old Vegas). Right next door to Koolsville Sacred Heart Tattoos. Located like 12
Minutes from the airport. I felt very safe in the hostel and the people were great. Had a blast hanging out in the common area pavilion with people from all over.. Michael the staff member was astounding at his job bringing everyone together. Thank you Diego for replacing the towels. The art work on the walls was created by the staff and they have a corner within to give artist an outlet. Bike rental on site. I will stay here if I go back to Vegas.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhA8rJEYs9nUXaOhNQ3j_duR&fid=0x0:0x6d11de27eeaf5915"],"When":"2025-11-10"},{"Name":"kirtap nitram","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUXjYmIzizadiaXP6ge0dpoWyozoVrqrmyRb0zYEQig4L7ZB1Wg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Lovely hostel super close to the strip, centrally located, made accomplishing all my business very convenient. Appreciate the International guests, learned a lot about different walks of life, and I hope to be back soon. Also the bed was firm, which I love, and everything was clean, modern and well-organized.

Also cool murals in the parking lot! (See attached photo)","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBNFLwjnCVSUpxYKlU_tdL_&fid=0x0:0x6d11de27eeaf5915"],"When":"2025-12-19"},{"Name":"VIJAY S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW4v35U7xLEBLLgO5gkNeb9bUygHgmn36h7YokfDjqcj0e2E5pW0Q=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Good vibe, great place to socialize. They (Michael, Deigo )take guests on a walking tour every evening. You ll meet some fun people here. Could be much more cleaner. The female receptionist was much more welcoming that the other 2 guys at the reception.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jaden Fox","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUvdICGNzuRxNKHBlZSFT_iFR4AzYE4AugCHxjaCJ7LUoUhXu8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I‚Äôve stayed at Sin City the last two years during EDC weekend, and I really can‚Äôt recommend it enough. It was a great find and a perfect alternative to staying at any of the resorts or casinos in Vegas. You‚Äôre right down the road from the strip, and there‚Äôs plenty of neat spots in the Arts District area. The complimentary breakfast and the cookouts are a treat, and you‚Äôll never meet cooler people than the other travelers and staff you‚Äôll meet here. They have the in for a lot of clubs and other events, so be sure to take advantage of that. You don‚Äôt have to be a party person either, there‚Äôs outdoor rec activities, tours, and plenty else that you can get set up with. Oh, and if you‚Äôre going to book, I recommend doing it directly through their website, it‚Äôs easier and cheaper than going through 3rd party services.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhADJTxmlR_0S4RpoIjI7GwG&fid=0x0:0x6d11de27eeaf5915"],"When":"2025-12-6"},{"Name":"Drew Dalenberg","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU9HTlUjZB_3Qlj2EOkqrykxJ1jcMjbAoACcR9Y0FSTSGcrUdTt=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I had a great time. I hadn‚Äôt been to Vegas since I was about 14, so it had been a long while, but the trip didn‚Äôt disappoint. I met some really friendly people from all over, and the staff‚Äîthere were only about three or four of them‚Äîwere super nice and easy to talk to.

The only thing for me is that I‚Äôm a tall, bigger guy, so the beds felt a bit small. But if you‚Äôre looking for a cheap place to stay with genuinely welcoming people, I‚Äôd definitely recommend it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jenny Brito","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXd6J3TZmr_QWGClUovZMQUkantmCqEzaEzMEpQj6YeiWjwaQ8F6g=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I loved the experience, the team was super welcoming, they have breakfast, and they even made a Christmas dinner for the guests. One of the staff members showed us several things in Old Vegas, and when I go back to Vegas I will definitely stay there again. Very good!","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 2101 Donna St, North Las Vegas, NV 89030
column18: Low-key hotel offering casual rooms & a garden, as well as complimentary parking & Wi-Fi
column31: [{"id":"crowd","name":"Crowd","options":[{"name":"LGBTQ+ friendly","enabled":true}]}]
column32:
[{"Name":"Rose Locklear","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIAZon3K8E2Q0dI2EbX_4w8UHT6_UdkWxARPnPLsmese0DknP8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I'll be completely honest. I had a terrible experience here because I broke the rules. The property manager is very strict about following the rules for the safety and protection of tenants and the surrounding community. Not respecting and following the contract will result in you losing the money you invested.

I did not properly communicate and lost $500 because of that. I was upset and felt taken advantage of. That the last I had due to losing my job. However THE RULES ARE THE RULES AND I SIGNED THEM.

This property is very clean. The rooms are impeccable. There are cleaning services/maid services. The safety is beyond anything I have ever experienced. It's quiet, and everyone respects everyone.

As long as you follow the rules of the contract, COMMUNICATE IMMEDIATELY, and are respectful... you will absolutely love this property and want to come back!

The fees are very decent, and the property manager will accommodate as much as he possibly can as long as you communicate with him....

I just wish I hadn't broken the ruüò≠üò≠üò≠üò≠","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"OnAir42173913487","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfCm-MBS7Itwd4h-55xcyygsVKq1IZbUTNyg17UKkQsT2C3oSXBlQ_-pGTl8imnrFVtVw=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"My husband and I booked a "too good to be true" deal through this company. Upon confirming with the hotel, my husband was informed of various additional charges and "fees" that also included a mystery deposit.  All told told to us well after the booking! I combed through the ad and confirmation emails and texts...it says NOTHING about these. ||I contacted the hotel again. They said I must take it up with the agency/site purchased on. Classic.||What does the agency say? Take it up with the hotel!||So, we attempt to just cancel the room bc we aren't going to pay hidden charges (illegal much?). Am I able to? NO! There is NO option to, and when I contact them, again, it's the same fiasco. ||Also, the hotel name was The Yellow Penthouse, LLC, in Las Vegas Nevada. ||AGODA.com is the travel site.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Katrina Wolfe","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUyDWM2exoRTkiH_hM1PvuAYGJaOneFq-2zLcWcFgOMZB5tvpdZug=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"My husband and I booked a "too good to be true" deal through this company. Upon confirming with the hotel, my husband was informed of various additional charges and "fees" that also included a mystery deposit.  All told told to us well after the booking! I combed through the ad and confirmation emails and texts...it says NOTHING about these.

I contacted the hotel again. They said I must take it up with the agency/site purchased on. Classic.

What does the agency say? Take it up with the hotel!

So, we attempt to just cancel the room bc we aren't going to pay hidden charges (illegal much?). Am I able to? NO! There is NO option to, and when I contact them, again, it's the same fiasco.

Also, the hotel name was The Yellow Penthouse, LLC, in Las Vegas, Nevada.

AGODA.com is the travel site.

Edit for response - Technicalities do not change the facts shared. You did not disclose this information when we called to inquire. We booked one of **your** rooms without the knowledge of additional charges and fees (that you admit are not posted on that site). Regardless of who, when, why...you are still obligated, morally at minimum, to assist in clarification and resolution.

Instead, you simply said "that's the norm" after mentioning the additional charges and told us to take it up with the reservation site.

As the **guests**, we took the time to review our reservations and call you directly for assistance, as is the responsible thing to do. You, however, failed to clarify and were entirely dismissive, as your response here further demonstrates.

Reviews are for the benefit of potential customers/guests/etc, and this is only one of dozens that mention struggling with the same issues. If the problem is so prevalent, I am reluctant to accept it as being the fault of a website that books guests for your establishment.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jose Juan Ibarra","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX98dViPe66Z01UevT-HhdSoO8T6_QdxBXbD2DeXiA55PMunaMI=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, Nobody's there they have a doorbell that nobody answered phone number the same email same I made a reservation check in at 3:00pm I was there till 4:15 pm calling them no Answer the place looks like the MUNSTER'S HOUSE, that's kind of messed up for people from out of town who make reservations and they do them dirty I cancelled the reservation I got changed $37.00 for cancellation","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jeff Gosselin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJhmXyHU8CqLCjXkXJyptJ1kD-BKqtKnFALqq7bIJma2Qmwhg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I stayed there s while back and the next day my card got a bunch of charges from Google Play. All .49 to. 99 cents. About 15 dollars worth. DO NOT STAY THERE and if you do use a one time digital use credit card","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Denise Stoesser","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU0moZ0WZq7kCJwTHUs71CDsH_rSq-RJ3222ihm6yiML81XUEWBxw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I was scammed. I've often wondered if I was picked at random or chosen. I shopped online for a good price and chose the penthouse because they were cheaper than the rest. I didn't care that it was the middle of gang territory and there would be no parking or amenities close by. So I booked and paid online. My receipt shows the room was paid in full aside from "incidentals, resort fees, or ancillary charges." But as I rounded the block looking for a spot to park they stopped me in the middle of the road to greet me and inform me of the additional $100 per night (and to avoid loud drama when I protested, I'm certain). I asked them to explain the extra charges as Incidentals are amenities, resort fees are 1 time not daily, and ancillary charges are room service, which they didn't offer. $100 a day is none of these. I didn't have the extra money so I was turned away without justification, a refund or offered an alternative - like a cheaper room or a shorter stay. I spent all I had on that room, so I was left homeless for the weekend. The picture of my online receipt has the dates blocked out, but is unedited.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIHM0ogKEICAgICJ1L61pAE&fid=0x0:0x702e780623075cd2"],"When":"2023-6-21"},{"Name":"Darts No City","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV5ebvQel3pv8iQLO-WZwcXkupD1j8jfeYAO-L_aGEHoOWbdenSLA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Nice place. Big house broken up into rooms for rent. Quiet, residential neighborhood with walking access to shopping.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Garrett White","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVqaMy9yXoD2sznFJVs4_R1edL_LO8ihLVYvM_uvOQXmJLgArSP=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"When I first got there my room wasn't ready so they let me stay in b-01and they promised a 100 dollar refund for not getting my room ready on time. They tried to charge me for dirty towels and other random things on the property but everything wasn't the cleanest to begin with. It's the staff's job to clean everything on the property not the customers. They also tried to charge me for not leaving before 11am I was supposed to leave at 11:30 am according to Expedia. This was my firt time in Las Vegas and it was not a good time. Do not rent a room from these people they have mental health issues or something.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIHM0ogKEICAgMCwxsqaQg&fid=0x0:0x702e780623075cd2"],"When":"2025-3-18"}]

column3: Howard Johnson by Wyndham Las Vegas near the Strip
column5: 165 E Tropicana Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89109
column18: Low-slung budget lodging with casual rooms & an outdoor pool, plus free parking & Wi-Fi.
column29: {"id":"105665015268924154812","name":"Howard Johnson by Wyndham Las Vegas near the Strip (Owner)","link":"https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/105665015268924154812"}

column32:
[{"Name":"J. H.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWcso5_3HhEnTS1nubc0wDJnWlZWSbmhgIHdYQCHF8bAxQmKX8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Upon arrival, it was quickly confirmed by the staff, including security personnel, that this place has "changed hands" & is now being run by Motel-6... Since the rates were what we sought, we decided that we'd follow through with our stay. The room was not, at all, a representation of what was advertised. Relatively clean however, somewhat dated, we made the better of the stay. Little things like no toilet paper, a broken toilet seat, the floors were not properly cleaned, the main door to the room had to be "giggled" to properly open & close it & the faucet in the shower/tub dripped plus the shut-off was installed backwards (hot was actually cold & visa versa). Booked thru a "3rd party"; the front desk stated that it could not print a final receipt ‚Äî the "3rd-party" had to provide that. Since the room actually provided what we sought; even still, a 2 star rating is very generous!! Motel 6 has been around for a long time & they MUST do better altogether! So much more can be shared in detail but the owners already know what needs to be improved. ALL front desk staff members we encountered were pleasent & professional which eased the sting of the overall experience.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Joshua Wass","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUHWSQAms2K9u5jr_xaOU36IboExyPbjtGGaxr_lMtMm86KZTNd=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"Now a Motel 6. Staff were nice. Location is great. Guests were loud and up late talking loudly outside and one guest spent the entire day in the car park with no shirt on telling his life story to someone in a car. You can hear everything through the wall. Super basic and old. No working tv channels, no kettle, no fridge. Felt safe and was cheap.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Scott Hattis","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU23DbdcWhTsBi0T53AnOoifxnwNvTc8JMm92nDAfJVKe2iZ_5B=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I had a terrible experience!

First, This place is a Howard Johnson, NOT A MOTEL 6!! However, this place has motel 6 logos all over it. It was a motel 6, but got bought out. This confuses people.

When I booked the room the listing said it was for motel 6.

This isn't even the worst that happened with my stay.

Absolutely no amenities whatsoever!  No mini fridge, no coffee maker, no microwave.

Sometimes you don't even get electricity. (Well, I didn't.)

I booked for 3 nights, on the second day the power went out. Can't charge my phone, can't watch TV, no lights so no shower. NOTHING!!!!!

Absolutely rediculous!!

When I asked the staff what they were going to do for us if the power isn't restored, they shrugged and said "awe well."

Don't make the mistake of booking here. You could spend a little more and get a hell of a lot more.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Marcus Lee","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWDolA3G4XxMqZfkuqWt0TtAgD3e6OgeOwHHTkv4bFN1Vxy7EWs=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"Worst motel I ever stayed in. Staffs at the counter were rude and didn‚Äôt bother to offer any advice when the motel had a blackout. Room keys were locked after 1 day of use, and the rooms smelt terrible, with nasty carpets, dead cockroach in the toilet and a constantly dripping bathroom ceiling when someone above showers. My goodness","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"unityasian grocery","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLVszK-TW0lWa4IMnoVlRK4Ep3uARgUByajuXsWpMsrHNOslA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"This motel worth zero star. I want to give zero but no choice. This is the worst motel ever I have never seen in my experience. When we enter the room, the rooms are smell very bad and no refrigerator, no microwave, no chair . If you don't smoke please make sure to check. We booked three rooms for three night. But we didn't stay over night cz we can't stand the smoke. We just stay like 2 hours and we left.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Mary Gibbs-Bolender","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVT9n3SNBxq23U_7nXZ9Grh6AG5zFT1jYYRWYow8Jd0CuIU0-Vo=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"I‚Äôve stayed here several times. It‚Äôs not a 5.0 but it used to be affordable.
I never had a problem putting a 200.deposit down for my pet. I always got it back. This visit they charged me 28.35 per night for the trip on top of room rate 80 something. Said they‚Äôve always done that. I found that a bit excessive for a 2star hotel with such a large pet deposit.
Make you call and ask about pet rates before you get her and asked if there is a nightly pet fee.
Some rooms are cleaner than others.
The doggy area is not cleaned everyday either. My dog will not go in a dirty area.
The people up front are pretty nice. I normally have to use my cell phone though to call them as I get a recording from the motel room that the mailbox is full try my call again later.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Johany Herrera","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXNhpHGAi69dPN3fzyrPxMWeeJ1rLwwNd8hkQBQxogEx0oZE0aj9A=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"This is, without a doubt, the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.
From the moment I opened the door, I was hit with an overwhelming stench of urine so strong it made me and my family feel physically sick.
The room was suffocatingly hot, and the air conditioner was completely broken.
Everything was filthy ‚Äî the one chair in the room was covered in multiple stains and smelled like someone had defecated on it.
The carpet was stained and filthy, and walking barefoot was out of the question.
The mattress was miserable ‚Äî uncomfortable, dirty, and full of sharp, unknown objects poking at us all night.
We chose this hotel because the pictures online looked beautiful, and the location near the Strip seemed perfect.
However, the photos on the website are completely misleading.
They are not even remotely close to the disgusting, run-down nightmare we experienced.
I feel completely deceived and betrayed.
This hotel should be ashamed of the false advertising and the conditions they are subjecting guests to.
I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone ‚Äî not even for free.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIHM0ogKEICAgMDo_aPv2wE&fid=0x0:0x4dcc0909eb42f59"],"When":"2025-4-28"},{"Name":"LIL 70X1C","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUN2ftTbD2GcoJ_cDStS0-iRrmUBjNbdF8-aEkIBy7Xcn9WARdH=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"I think I had more luck with the room than on the gambling machines.

The room was ‚Äúpretty‚Äù clean. A light confusing smell was in the room, which vanished after opening the door for a couple minutes. The carpet had a couple stains which seemed to be vomit, but the rest of it was clean.

The acs heater was not working. But it‚Äôs Las Vegas, so don‚Äôt come before spring ;)

The bathroom was pretty clean too, and for this affordable price including free parking there was nothing really to complain about.

10 min on foot and you‚Äôre on the strip, really good located.

At the end you know what you gonna get for this price, otherwise look for ‚Äúcheaper‚Äù hotels with a big surprising service fee (which was luckily included in this motel). The free parking was also a good reason, normally it can be really expensive there.

The staff wasn‚Äôt really friendly, but it could be worse.

I would recommend for traveler‚Äôs who lost or wanna loose all their money in the casinos.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 3227 Civic Center Dr, North Las Vegas, NV 89030
column31: null
column32:
[{"Name":"sophia Mendez","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU1yPEwXepnm88-MzXP0H8ISSKc7nLbSG48CUhVDvjjmJz6BsDGRQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The rooms are clean and beds are comfy then the price is right they only charge a deposit and  no resort fees. The service at the front desk is awesome and they accommodate your wants if they have the availability. The area is iffy as there is homeless and stray animals but the hotel overall inside is quiet and clean.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Shawn Crnich","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWvgbdS7yA6uvr-gokBybIFcPjfPDKmN7fmxGuHdzLP7-wkeQgl=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"Employees were nice enough. However, this place is pretty rough. We chose it as a stop off point on a road trip for its location to the freeway and it had a pool. It was indeed accessible, however pool closes for the winter as it is not heated... Not listed anywhere when we were booking.

Kind of a sketchy place for kids. Just keep that in mind. I have stayed at worse places, to be sure. Just know what you are getting into.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Melissa Mullins","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVHSNTUgE0jqYziOY4rVxrRmUFY3dOY6vfBviBqO-THbgd8IXEEfw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Cute cantina hotel and casino slightly off the beaten path from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Great service and staff. Easy check in! Hallways smelling slightly of weed, but it's Vegas. Rooms are nice, not much on views, and the beds were full sized but comfortable.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Trinity Ross","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJmTE_x5ljo5zdEMM8pKHSXMUqMzFrSZZ7rGDppifH0vwAJlA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Besides the employees who were cleaning this is one of the rudest, most shady, staff I've ever encountered. They offer free drinks if you are playing then don't bring them over. Staff kept changing their stories when we have a problem, and on multiple occasions accused my family of things we didn't do. Just overall disappointed with the the staff and management. Housekeeping staff was AMAZING.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Curvy Baby","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIG_94xP9f43ETwRKKyytJYKlsJTfFZBLOZwyWH4SNNT3GH6Q=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT BED BUGS!!!!! I stayed here for 3 nights and the room appeared to be clean but WAS NOT. The sheets had a few stains and my apartment got bed bugs when I got back which has been a nightmare, all from 3 days in a dirty hotel, they offer free drinks when you play and don't give any drinks, and they‚Äôre extremely rude at the concierge desk.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Esintrik Odom","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW0nbGVB3QWk5aVwe-Y7MWbAIGFpuVOvxG8ijc3u6AZjN2E0PHm=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"On July 26, 2025 , my spouse and I arrived at Hotel Jefe, the manager immediately and dismissively stated, "We have no availability," in a hostile tone, before we even had a chance to mention our reservation.
Once we informed him that we did, in fact, have a booking, he then repeatedly told us our room was "not ready." We waited for over an hour past the official check-in time of 3:00 PM. During this extended wait, we observed this same manager checking in other guests, and notably, accommodating a walk-in customer by finding them a room right away.
This stark contrast in treatment, coupled with his initial hostile demeanor and refusal to acknowledge our reservation, felt deeply personal and discriminatory. We were ultimately forced to seek alternative, safer accommodation because the environment felt unwelcoming and prejudiced.
We later contacted Expedia regarding this unacceptable situation, and they informed us they had no policy to address such hostile or discriminatory encounters and would not provide a refund. This entire experience was distressing and unacceptable. The hotel's manager displayed severe unprofessionalism and apparent bias, and Expedia failed to support us in a critical situation. We strongly advise others to be aware of this concerning conduct.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Saturday","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV35WH0pBHqxXS-LBR3jeAlTRQOlyz2fOgdMJempWi4N4d31vc=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Worst hotel experience ever.  Ever!  House keeping was fine, no bugs, plenty of hot water.  No place to hang a towel, no hangers, no coffee maker, no hairdryer Walls and floors are paper thin.  We got put next door to a loud television and beneath 2 very happy children.  We hadn't dirtied anything so they moved us, but it wasn't a good move.  Next room had a broken tv.  Literally broken, and the remote didn't work.  Office offered to trade remotes, but then stated that all the remotes were keyed to specific TVs, so how was trading remotes going to help? It didn't. They traded the tv out the next day, so the screen wasn't broken any more, but the remote still didn't work.  They kept asking if the sensor was blocked.  The volume worked, but nothing else.  For the next 2 days we would leave, telling them our TV didn't work. We would come back to a turned on tv with a working remote. So we would turn it off, but later when we turned it back on it would not work again.  Maybe there was a trick to get it working, but they didn't tell us what it was.  On the evening of day 3 the TV finally worked reliably.  The morning of day 4, which was check out day, the neighbor turned on their TV so loud we thought it was in our room, at 6:30 am.  The refrigerator rack was missing.  The non-smoking room is smelled like smoke.  Twice they told us security would quiet neighbors.  Security never showed up.  And they shouldn't have to quiet happy children anyway.  The hotel wasn't so full that they couldn't space the occupied rooms out.  They say you get what you paid for, but I've paid a lot less and gotten much more.  At this point they'd have to pay me to come back.  This could go on and on and on.  I'll stop here.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Bow tie luv bug","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXcRM3aIwaog3my6wA64Hu8QGAZ6C2YQmkWN2JcnsPn06DmGXY=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Major upgrade from what it used to be. One of the few hotels that doesn‚Äôt require a credit card. They accept cash,","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 1208 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89104

column32:
[{"Name":"Tell Double","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXE9517Jk3EU65tTKaZtbxfLpTamxCICQ9zS-K12Wf2IWCqBO8=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê BEST HOSTEL IN LAS VEGAS!!!!

I had an amazing stay at Sin City Hostel ‚Äî truly five stars all around! The staff here is extremely friendly, polite, and helpful, and the energy is just great. The rooms were clean and spacious, with daily housekeeping keeping everything fresh. Bathrooms were always clean and well maintained.

I loved the security of the code-locked doors and the cozy patio area outside ‚Äî nice, green, and peaceful. The common area was perfect for getting work done, with a big-screen TV and plenty of space to relax. Quiet hours were respected, which made it easy to rest and stay focused.

The free breakfast was delicious every morning and a great way to start the day. Overall, everything was smooth, comfortable, and well-run. I got a lot of my event work done here in a quiet and productive environment.

Great people, great staff, and a great hostel. Highly recommend ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be returning! üåê‚ú®

‚∏ª Martell Edwards  @Telldouble
Telldouble Productions

‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®
‚ú®‚òÅÔ∏èDream B.I.G.‚òÅÔ∏è ‚Ñ¢Ô∏è ‚ú®
‚ú®(BELIEVE IN GOD)       ‚ú® ‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú® ‚ú®.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"jt","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKg5DOn5w4Z2mJanbJQk8gpydnNUqPCEBk1uU3LeowXy6C8pw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"At first I didn't like how there's only one bathroom in each room (completely not soundproof) and the beds without curtains.
BUT this hostel had an amazing breakfast (toast, fruits, and yogurt) and free events. Everyday there is a walking tour led by Michael where you get to gamble with free money and you learn about Las Vegas history and unique places in Fremont Street. By staying at this hostel, you also get free access to nightclubs (with famous DJs) you otherwise would have had to pay for. This place is the best for solo-travelers of all ages to meet new people, and gives you an experience MORE than what you paid for. Thank you to all the friendly staff that made my stay here!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"T","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXKQboTinNUr5_UxySAF5siZaAJT0s2A92djjxWOM3gBZKSbEz1=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Exactly what you expect but better. The rooms were clean and spacious. My junk was very comfortable. The location of the hostel was great! Located in the art district which is the center between The Strip and Downtown (Old Vegas). Right next door to Koolsville Sacred Heart Tattoos. Located like 12
Minutes from the airport. I felt very safe in the hostel and the people were great. Had a blast hanging out in the common area pavilion with people from all over.. Michael the staff member was astounding at his job bringing everyone together. Thank you Diego for replacing the towels. The art work on the walls was created by the staff and they have a corner within to give artist an outlet. Bike rental on site. I will stay here if I go back to Vegas.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhA8rJEYs9nUXaOhNQ3j_duR&fid=0x0:0x6d11de27eeaf5915"],"When":"2025-11-10"},{"Name":"kirtap nitram","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUXjYmIzizadiaXP6ge0dpoWyozoVrqrmyRb0zYEQig4L7ZB1Wg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Lovely hostel super close to the strip, centrally located, made accomplishing all my business very convenient. Appreciate the International guests, learned a lot about different walks of life, and I hope to be back soon. Also the bed was firm, which I love, and everything was clean, modern and well-organized.

Also cool murals in the parking lot! (See attached photo)","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBNFLwjnCVSUpxYKlU_tdL_&fid=0x0:0x6d11de27eeaf5915"],"When":"2025-12-19"},{"Name":"VIJAY S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW4v35U7xLEBLLgO5gkNeb9bUygHgmn36h7YokfDjqcj0e2E5pW0Q=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Good vibe, great place to socialize. They (Michael, Deigo )take guests on a walking tour every evening. You ll meet some fun people here. Could be much more cleaner. The female receptionist was much more welcoming that the other 2 guys at the reception.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jaden Fox","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUvdICGNzuRxNKHBlZSFT_iFR4AzYE4AugCHxjaCJ7LUoUhXu8=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I‚Äôve stayed at Sin City the last two years during EDC weekend, and I really can‚Äôt recommend it enough. It was a great find and a perfect alternative to staying at any of the resorts or casinos in Vegas. You‚Äôre right down the road from the strip, and there‚Äôs plenty of neat spots in the Arts District area. The complimentary breakfast and the cookouts are a treat, and you‚Äôll never meet cooler people than the other travelers and staff you‚Äôll meet here. They have the in for a lot of clubs and other events, so be sure to take advantage of that. You don‚Äôt have to be a party person either, there‚Äôs outdoor rec activities, tours, and plenty else that you can get set up with. Oh, and if you‚Äôre going to book, I recommend doing it directly through their website, it‚Äôs easier and cheaper than going through 3rd party services.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhADJTxmlR_0S4RpoIjI7GwG&fid=0x0:0x6d11de27eeaf5915"],"When":"2025-12-6"},{"Name":"Drew Dalenberg","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU9HTlUjZB_3Qlj2EOkqrykxJ1jcMjbAoACcR9Y0FSTSGcrUdTt=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I had a great time. I hadn‚Äôt been to Vegas since I was about 14, so it had been a long while, but the trip didn‚Äôt disappoint. I met some really friendly people from all over, and the staff‚Äîthere were only about three or four of them‚Äîwere super nice and easy to talk to.

The only thing for me is that I‚Äôm a tall, bigger guy, so the beds felt a bit small. But if you‚Äôre looking for a cheap place to stay with genuinely welcoming people, I‚Äôd definitely recommend it.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jenny Brito","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXd6J3TZmr_QWGClUovZMQUkantmCqEzaEzMEpQj6YeiWjwaQ8F6g=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I loved the experience, the team was super welcoming, they have breakfast, and they even made a Christmas dinner for the guests. One of the staff members showed us several things in Old Vegas, and when I go back to Vegas I will definitely stay there again. Very good!","Images":null,"When":""}]

column3: OYO Oasis Motel Las Vegas I-15
column5: 1731 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89104
column18: Unpretentious rooms in a straightforward hotel featuring a leafy courtyard, plus parking & Wi-Fi.

column32: [{"Name":"Harrison Law","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUN9PzPCB_2uy6X1XcOu5uPRGMiMXU-xjBcXwEK3mY923KbMPXa=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Rooms had a strong smell of smoke (room was noted as non smoking), no separation of bedroom and bath, it was just a open wall, no toilet paper, a panel next to the toilet was open and exposing some plumbing, the walls and shower were all quite dirty. The bed had some flakey residue on all corners under the sheets. There were stains on the pillow cases, bed sheets and covers. Overall the room had a funky smell along with the smoke. Did not even try staying the night, did not match the pictures at all. Not sure where these 5 star reviews are from, but I would recommend going just about anywhere else if you‚Äôre here for vacation. None of the 5 star reviews make sense or match anythign from what I saw or experianced.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Damariea Scott","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLKGs4BUBz5EReV4zSB5ZDUYluHj7TH7HdfhtZMCBPcKLVLQA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Watch out the front desk worker is a scammer Went to the smoke shop that's attached with the motel. The guy raised suspicions when he didn't tell me my total. I asked him he told me my total was $8.66 unlocked my debit card for that amount. The card declined twice i checked to see how much he was running the card for and it was $3 more than what he was telling me was being charged. I asked them if they had a debit fee, he said no and i asked why i was being charged more than what we being told he got mad and told me i can shop somewhere else if i feel as if he was stealing which i know for sure he was stealing. He also called my bluff and asked if he would want me to charge his own card to see if it would charge him the same. Insinuating that my bank was the reason i was being charged extra i told him yes try it with his card and he got mad as if that was a question i asked him to do when he was the one who asked me to do it on his own. The worker needs to be investigated!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Maritza Gonzalez","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUfF-amV2J7HpP_3kRVk9rjuOkVUQpZEHZqfLcYSRE4G5o4UNqe=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I was currently staying at Oyo Hotel and Casino and I decided to extend my night.
