column32:
[{"Name":"Roman","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLpfNb4KdnRqz5qfC9S8qsfGvDO9mi3iJtbGqUWY2BEWoaByVU=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"After walking the Strip for a while, we wanted to recharge and noticed Bottled Blonde. It was mid‚Äëday on an early week day, so the place was relatively quiet, which suited us perfectly. We sat at the bar, enjoyed excellent service, and admired the stylish d√©cor and lively vibe. I can easily imagine this spot packed and high energy at night.

The draft beers were a bit pricey, but that seems to be the norm in Vegas these days. The atmosphere reminded me of a classier version of Hooters, with a fun, casual energy and a polished look. We stayed about an hour and left feeling satisfied and refreshed.
Next time we are in town we will definitely pop back in and try the food to see how it measures up. Overall, Bottled Blonde is worth a visit.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhD6axpM91lDQBhTS6LV5qQY&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2026-1-16"},{"Name":"JF Bruns","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU8qj-3VnkslgAkXe5DRemXf82Ohdc96iDudG6GVhsdwe2p331t=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"12/25 - 10+ on the noise scale so don't come here to chat with those your with.  11:00 on a Saturday morning and got right in. Only 2 bartenders so drinks came pretty slow / or never ( a lesson on being honest with your customer was learned by our server) Interesting brunch menu on the weekends so tried the corned beef hash, actually used a good grade of corned beef so it was better than most.  Wife had pizza bites appetizer that she liked.  Disappointed in the beer selection, didn't have the one of 6 that I wanted / keg was empty on choice #2 (hence the lesson for the server)  Reluctantly giving 4* as I will give them another shot for my business.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBOUy2mgmLD815SLB0CTTGe&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2025-12-6"},{"Name":"Darrin Rumph","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIMUIR5h6kT4WqpaSKqRExPFkenqQUx_a3IGZFNPv-FxOTiUw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"We entered, and I advised them that I had a reservation. The host said seating downstairs would be immediate, but if we wanted seating upstairs, it would be about a 10-minute wait. I chose to wait for upstairs.¬† While we were hanging around, I did a scan of the property.

There were TVs everywhere, a beer pong setup downstairs, and a lot of activity. Very nice open layout. There was even a little corner where a live band could set up. I was hovering around the host‚Äôs podium and saw another party go up to the second floor before we were seated. I went back to the podium to check on our seating status, and she acted like she had never seen me before and looked confused. Then she informed us to go upstairs to see another host who would help us.¬† We went upstairs, but nobody was at the podium. A few minutes later, she came around the corner. We told her we‚Äôd like an outside table, and she led us to the balcony area with a large couch overlooking the Vegas Strip. The couch didn‚Äôt really have much shade and was getting a lot of direct sunlight. Wifey found the one shaded corner and settled in. I was fine with the direct sunlight.¬† Our goal was just to get something light for lunch to share. We reviewed the menu, and nothing really jumped out at us‚Äîit looked like typical bar food: pizzas, wings, the usual. We decided to share the fried mac & cheese bites and chicken tenders. We reviewed the beer selection, it had many of the usual suspects and a few local craft options. When our server came by, we started to tell her which beers we wanted, and she informed us all the kegs were down and there was no draft beer. After hearing that, we just decided to just leave and go somewhere else.¬† I was actually excited to try this new place, but unfortunately, it wasn‚Äôt a great first experience. The best thing I noticed was the layout, upstairs included. However, the beer and food menu, as well as the initial podium service, were not that great.  2.5 Rating","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhCoRy16kwTEvgpqtnGtkwYR&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2025-10-17"},{"Name":"Zack Murdock","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXAao5fJNIqKHeHOzdGpAph8Y61tkr2OTuTz9mxo0foKlz8Rdpb=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Predatory scam operation. Unsafe. Avoid at all costs.

I bought these F1 tickets months ago, before they were even publicly listed and then quietly delisted from Bottled Blonde‚Äôs own website. I paid nearly $1,000 PER PERSON for what they advertised as premium rooftop access with views of the race ‚Äî I got them as a birthday surprise for my girlfriend. Instead, what we walked into was a blatant bait-and-switch scam, run by the most hostile management team I‚Äôve ever encountered in Las Vegas.

Let me be clear:
There were NO views of the race. Zero.
Why? Because they put a giant VIP table section across the entire viewing line ‚Äî meaning only VIP tables had any sightline of the track, and the rest of us were shoved behind furniture, bodies, and barriers with absolutely no visibility.

And yet they sold these tickets as ‚Äúviewing access.‚Äù This wasn‚Äôt an accident. It was deliberate and predatory.

Dozens of attendees around me were furious as well. Most of them had purchased through StubHub, where the seller was listed as Bottled Blonde‚Äîeven though the staff later claimed they ‚Äúnever sold tickets through any third party.‚Äù That is a lie, and I saw it with my own eyes. The majority of guests I spoke to were holding StubHub confirmations.

They also kept changing and shifting entrance times all week long, clearly to squeeze as much money out of people as possible and keep expectations foggy right up until the moment you walked in and realized there was no view.

And the final insult? They sold same-day GA access at the door for a fraction of what I paid, and it was literally the same thing as ‚Äúpremium GA‚Äù ‚Äî no difference except the price. It felt like employees were improvising prices on the spot. Whether or not money was being pocketed internally, the entire operation gave off the vibe of a venue trying to milk every dollar from confused guests during F1 weekend.

But the worst part of the night was the behavior of the manager, Alex, and the management team in general. Alex was shockingly rude, dismissive, confrontational, and acted as if guests pointing out the scams were somehow the problem. When I calmly raised the obvious issues ‚Äî no views, fake seat numbers, misleading ads ‚Äî his response wasn‚Äôt professionalism. It was aggression. At one point he even threatened to trespass me simply for questioning why I paid nearly a thousand dollars for nothing that was promised.

Given how small and petty he acted, I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if he‚Äôs already planning his next shopping spree at Gap Kids, which is about the only place his ego and management skills belong. Corporate management should check the accounting from last night before some of that ends up spent on children‚Äôs clothes for their child manager.

And the ‚Äúfree food‚Äù they advertised? Pure slop. Not premium, not curated, not remotely aligned with the price point ‚Äî just low-quality cafeteria-tier food thrown together and passed off as some kind of F1 hospitality. And the so-called open bar was another scam: it didn‚Äôt even open until the race was already underway. By the time anyone could access it, the event you supposedly paid for was in full swing. It was an ‚Äúopen bar‚Äù in name only ‚Äî deliberately delayed, clearly designed to minimize what they had to provide.

This venue is unsafe, predatory, and openly hostile to paying customers. No one should ever spend a dollar here. Frankly, the way they operated during F1 weekend, they deserve to collapse under their own financial misconduct, and Alex should never work in Las Vegas hospitality again.

I‚Äôll be joining Sarah and Michael in their complaints, filings, and every next step. This place should not be allowed to operate the way it does.

Avoid this venue. Tell your friends to avoid it. If you value your safety, your money, or basic respect, do not go here.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhAaBOzfCEY521B4b0ZqK3p4&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2025-11-23"},{"Name":"Jase Nisveta","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWgmVbBo-q9fbeyhazhAFjv17E-PE7EKHO36mF3AgDO3HZYYKg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Had an incredible experience at Bottle Blonde, and a huge part of that was thanks to our bartender, Calais. From the moment we sat down, her energy, professionalism, and attention to detail set the tone for the entire night. She was personable without being intrusive, knowledgeable about the menu, and genuinely cared about making sure everything was perfect. The kind of bartender who reads the room effortlessly and makes you feel like a VIP without trying too hard.

I ordered the Wagyu truffle burger, and it was absolutely phenomenal. Perfectly cooked, rich, juicy, and layered with deep, savory flavor. The truffle infusion was balanced and luxurious, not overpowering, and every bite tasted like a high-end steakhouse disguised as comfort food. Easily one of the best burgers I‚Äôve had in a long time.

Calais paired the food and drinks flawlessly, offering great recommendations and keeping everything flowing smoothly all night. You can tell she takes pride in her craft and in creating an experience, not just serving drinks. Exceptional service, amazing food, and an atmosphere that hits on all levels. If you‚Äôre at Bottle Blonde, do yourself a favor and sit at the bar with Calais ‚Äî she elevates the whole experience.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Josie Ratcliffe","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLM3QvzPuE32oxZlw5X9mzHyItBfx-LF_7PVk59y9p222tL-w=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Highly recommend. The staff went above and beyond for me and my partner to put the UFC on the TV outside. Very welcoming and brilliant service. Great views of the fountains and strip. Food was also lovely. Will definitely be returning on our next trip.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhCCG_tb593hPqHZ8QL3xZsn&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2025-8-17"},{"Name":"Kevin Jones","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWpyA88OC2w7Y6MsmzxRvXXU2MxbXWfjXJUoelhMpW2T20liJk=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We were hot and came in for a pit stop the hostess gives us a look and says you look parched, take the elevator to the rooftop...what a choice...we get to the rooftop it equipped with comfortable chairs and loveseats....misters galore. The view was killer, we were most comfortable, it has to be the most comfortable rooftop bar on the strip. We didn't order food, our drinks were strong and flavorful.  My only gripe was this chintzy entertainment fee, when I asked about it the waitress replies it's for the wi-fi and tv's....come on, there wasn't any live entertainment.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhAmIw5-t3Wksrx6lZ7kGSEi&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2025-9-3"},{"Name":"Oai Truong","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVSvCaQ4LolRyTn9k1ryutgPr9o3gZQs6AKiDsGTz4JuRDHhfEe0Q=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Came in just to see the live band, but with all the windows open you can watch from the street as well. The band was incredible, great energy. This would be a fun place to party on the strip.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDmhH0e3jsQ3SEDMemhviDV&fid=0x0:0x7c267ccc5e3dad9a"],"When":"2025-10-2"}]

column32:
[{"Name":"Jennifer DeVera","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIDG0CIfUqTV_OeKvBRjszZfVjZbSYCsTX3i1pFtpC1l6o2Rg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Had an awesome experience with getting on the guest list! Listed twice for Stadium Swim on two different days, it was a smooth and easy process. Free entry for women + a free drink valued at $15 or less.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBYbuUiNqmXSjl_kX6CGyev&fid=0x0:0xadfd18fbfbd039fa"],"When":"2025-7-15"},{"Name":"Leticia Rojas","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJzhQqX7QpcEy03c5GL_rSUzG08WNzDaNAWnZc-KOQ5HM7TDw=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Loved it. It was easy to select where to go based on type of event, type of music and using the calendar to see who will be performing  At each location was easy to get in.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kesha Mcgruder","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVp9YoX3UxxN-LWyPJFRKCMIdB0luDUdlErzNLDv62Mno1SYomO=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Booked on to this in January, but our trip wasnt until September. Amazing service. Would use again! We used it for TAO Beach club entry. 10/10","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBnJ9Jd644kO3n7nWkY6SVZ&fid=0x0:0xadfd18fbfbd039fa"],"When":"2025-9-21"},{"Name":"Chris Ervin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKOq476U2Wq6FMquw3Al-IKqVpwFyGgRBJfV9MeryxMIHhCCA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Thanks Matthew Kahn. We walked up showed them your email for the guest list and moved straight to the front. Going back in may hopefully we can do it again and get you taken care of for the help.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Eric Martinez","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUqWyTpvIWfjv0L4tPINDS2paD9faROV3oiaqmo-xyVwoxMlIkq=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"It was an amazing experience!
We came to Vegas for my daughter‚Äôs bday weekend and happened that one of her favorite DJs (DJ Claptone) was going to play at Marquee nighttime pool party.
She was thrilled and excited I got us on guest list and experience was phenomenal!!
Thank you so much.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBdlaXZ2GgE-WQJ0jmUCORN&fid=0x0:0xadfd18fbfbd039fa"],"When":"2025-7-19"},{"Name":"Sara Holmes","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUvijApEl5zgYz8qzUxN5m1s5eCZpQKtLTtCp3kV45RJdjMiSSh6w=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"So easy to sign up and get in the door! I was on the guest list for Stadium Swim, it came with a free drink. I was very thankful, saved me money! And the place was a great time! Thank you!!!","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDkYDzD6zgTCveZfq-UfIlX&fid=0x0:0xadfd18fbfbd039fa"],"When":"2025-11-3"},{"Name":"Juan Terry","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJ21Ouhtlcm2qdArAzRkRa_mwS0m6MwQptHKsWbMp8V9jfp4A=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"A friend told me about the list to get into Vegas night clubs for FREE. I actually didn't believe him. But I found the website and entered the information and I got a text message within an hour saying we had been added to the list, and more details would be coming soon. We just followed the instructions, and we got in the club for free, before everyone got there, and Geezy was performing that night. Definitely 5 stars for how simple the process is, and it saved us $50 a piece getting in the club. Checking in was easy and we had great time.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"xthrillerplaysmc roblox","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWjoJXdAhE99oW2vpV5FZ-Xg52bcfeP6-gLvSLsJbXmVb3vkQHp=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I have such an amazing time. I felt so special VIP style I didn‚Äôt have to pay for anything. I recommend to anyone. It is a beautiful experience.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIHM0ogKELHbvILu2P3IhgE&fid=0x0:0xadfd18fbfbd039fa"],"When":"2025-6-7"}]

column5: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109
column18: Chic property with a half-size Eiffel Tower & a Paris-inspired street, plus a pool & a casino.

column32:
[{"Name":"Carol","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUpIKtRSXhbWR4YVLUtDJi1W1uPDgGst7f96pfj-ejJ3Gwr27c=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Overall experience was great, good location,clean nice rooms, nice food options in the hotel.
I think it would have been nice if there were a bit (or some) more amenities in the room.

Pool- was closed, and we were not notified about it before booking, which was a shame.

Gluten free option, there were, but quite scarce, which was not very acommodating.

All in all, my time there was nice.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBaZjUPsiRd9SUzNGVqx2iF&fid=0x0:0x4544b406fe1e5c01"],"When":"2026-2-14"},{"Name":"Ali Raza (Yasin)","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUlWAX0rn1sLLDpJZipA6xDZzrbG2Loj_Rip6vFTGftJEZymWo33A=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"& Sweet)
‚Äã"Had a wonderful stay at [Hotel Name]! The rooms were spotless, and the staff was incredibly friendly. Perfect location for exploring [City Name]. Highly recommended!"
‚ÄãOption 2: Details ke saath (Detailed Review)
‚Äã"I had a great experience here. The check-in was smooth, and the room was very comfortable and clean. I especially loved the [ek cheez jo achhi lagi, jaise: Breakfast / View / Service]. The location is very convenient. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to the US!"
‚ÄãOption 3: Sirf Keywords (Agar zyada nahi likhna)
‚Äã"Excellent service, super clean rooms, and a great location. 5 stars!"","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Siddhant Mishra","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX_SDBmriU3kV-kH1VlPD1jmGbeM-4XtPnVFl644PXhkn5qzmuVEA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We had an amazing experience here! We had some issue with the first room that we got but the manager Christina and Heather at the reception went out of their way to move us to another room quickly. And it was around New Years, so very busy time. We loved the room. Clean, spacious, comfortable. It has great views of the strip and of the city from the other side. We will definitely be coming back to stay here and recommend it to anyone else.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDQVu6augQdS4xZdtariYK8&fid=0x0:0x4544b406fe1e5c01"],"When":"2026-1-16"},{"Name":"Mary Circelli","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIDa-S_iBMaElQyCuJyl9_w2vD_h_Vmgla495ftQBLKL4QFHQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Paris is a very nice hotel. Our suite room was very spacious with two full bathrooms, one with a huge soaking tub and one with a walk in shower and the room was clean. Being someone with back problems, I will say that the beds are very comfortable and it also was nice to have a small sofa and two wing chairs so we didn't have to sit up on the bed all the time while in the room. The service staff were very courteous and responded quickly.         I guess my only real issue was one of the toilet bowls kept backing up.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhB9a4EhV0LPopD-PiB97zyd&fid=0x0:0x4544b406fe1e5c01"],"When":"2026-1-20"},{"Name":"Vy H.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXh0KxVqwDE2ZbHS9bzfcPnyt0Lr9qQCvHsad3Otow-juwuL4q3=s120-c-rp-mo-ba7-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Stayed in the Versailles Tower twice this month, once in a regular Versailles Room and once in the Versailles Executive Suite.  Obviously the suite was much better, more spacious and bigger bathroom, with a fridge too‚Äîbut decor wise both were similar.  Rooms are chic and clean, beds are comfy and view of the strip/sphere is nice!

Check-in is located in Horseshoe and if you are there during normal hours, you can check-in at the vip room‚Äîthey offered champagne and small bottles of water too.  By the Versailles ground elevators, there‚Äôs a cafe and small snack shop which is convenient.

Casino wise, Paris is pretty energetic and always a good amount of people there.  Lots of food places too!","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDpAir91NKYc9PmZ6j4M_1X&fid=0x0:0x4544b406fe1e5c01"],"When":"2026-1-26"},{"Name":"Arif rahim","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXZTHeH6x8Pu6Z9Hd9VgijpS7V229GPdTkS_CTmk9DqSaBmN-o=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Paris Las Vegas is a blast! üòä It's got that French flair with a half-scale Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, and Parisian streetscapes. The hotel's central location on the Strip is unbeatable, with the Bellagio Fountains right across the street.

*Must-Do Experiences:*

- _Eiffel Tower Viewing Deck_: Get breathtaking views of the Strip, especially at night ($35-$45 per person).
- _Mon Ami Gabi_: Savor French cuisine on the patio, perfect for people-watching and fountain views.
- _Vanderpump √† Paris_: Enjoy creative cocktails in a chic setting.
- _Beer Park_: Relax with giant Jenga and Strip views ¬π ¬≤ ¬≥.

*Dining:*

- _Eiffel Tower Restaurant_: Fine dining with stunning views.
- _Gordon Ramsay Steak_: Sizzling steaks and celebrity chef vibes.
- _Mon Ami Gabi_: Classic French bistro fare.

*Insider Tips:*

- Visit the Eiffel Tower at sunset or twilight for magic.
- Use the hotel app for check-in to skip lines.
- Book early for patio seats at Mon Ami Gabi ¬π ‚Å¥ ¬≤.

Would you like to know more about Paris Las Vegas' amenities or check availability for specific dates?","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"A. Martin","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK5DaJmzEiKDVUlCz2fHQp0pYHhfxuqvJLbtCYiX-KZ3YOTyQ=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"It's a beautiful venue, with a great area for conferences. It has shopping and dining that fits everyone's needs and wants. All employees are helpful when asked questions. Located in a great area of the strip making it easy to walk to other locations on your "to see and do" list.  The casino is indoor linked to another Caesars casino,  The Horseshoe. Both casinos are clean,  and air purification systems work well.  I did not smell like cigarettes when I left,  and the smoke did not bother me.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Marc-Louis Paprzyca","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUykj6pT26ZZ1p20EsXn6bp0FjGU_2lP2VCChgWZ627wpLaaIZutA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The location is central to the strip which makes it easy to get anywhere by just walking.

We loved our room in the Bordeaux tower which was recently renovated. The wonderfully nice agent MJ at check-in offered us an upgrade to a a corner room with a terrace that included a view right across the street from the Bellagio and a view of the Eiffel Tower. We took up the offer and loved it.

My only complaint is that the fitness center was small with pretty beat up equipment that could use repairs. Otherwise the casino, lobbies, and other common areas were quite clean.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhAsreRbew-Kr6tKSzqFmCPA&fid=0x0:0x4544b406fe1e5c01"],"When":"2026-2-8"}]

column3: OYO Hotel and Casino Las Vegas
column5: 115 E Tropicana Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89109
column18: Casual casino hotel offering low-key quarters, some with Strip views, plus 24-hour dining & a pool.
column31: null
column32:
[{"Name":"B Kay","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjX9BYkhMDg7vAjq4e7NrdjGRKmTL8iiJEBjbi9eWQuEyiJh9g4=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We had a genuinely good stay here and want to call out the front desk staff, especially Anthony, who really made the experience stand out. From the start, he was open, transparent, and consistently helpful. Every time we interacted with him, he took the time to answer our questions, explain things clearly, and offer suggestions about the area since it was our first time staying here. That kind of service makes a real difference, and he absolutely delivered.

The room was clean and comfortable, and for the price, it exceeded our expectations. Nothing fancy, but solid and well-maintained, which is honestly what matters most.

If you play Blackjack, this place is a bit of a hidden gem. They have $5 tables with proper 3-to-2 payouts, which is getting harder and harder to find on the Strip. It‚Äôs a great spot to actually play rather than deal with bad rules everywhere else.

Location-wise, it‚Äôs very convenient‚Äîclose to MGM and within easy walking distance of a lot of good spots on the Strip, without the chaos and price tag of staying right in the middle of it.

Overall, this was a great value stay with excellent service. Anthony at the front desk really helped make our trip special, and we‚Äôd happily stay here again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jennifer Merklein","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXrUpl22DgS7uDxx7BpGqy_R1H7MHhWjipMyGO326-xI7zlxGFI=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Our room looks old, but clean. The halways and elevators did need some vacuuming though.
Close to the airport, so expect some noice once in a while including at night.
Air-conditioning/heater is a bit noisy, but tolerable. We were just happy to have a nice warm room without spending $200 more if we booked at fancy hotels.
Parking is $20 a day, so be prepared for that.
Over all, we did have a good stay. Nice and clean king size bed and roomy at the 19th floor.
Beautiful view.
We requested for a room with a microwave because I needed to have something warm in the morning while waiting for the restaurants to open. I usually bring my own tea bags and a coffee mug when comming to Las Vegas since most restaurants open at 10 am.
I also noticed a lot of guests have their pets with them so I wish I brought my cat with me.
Pets are allowed in this hotel, I didn't know that when I booked.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Kevin Carlos","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXM_Dln_OnA_mE2Dhc9J2r6Qf7MPdEawpqZuw88W29LXkXJmeID=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Location was great!! Across from the MGM. Within the strip basically. Place was still under renovation. Got some great deals for a room. The room was a bit dirty and can be updated. The 2 queen beds were a little uneven and I basically sank in them.  Otherwise it served its purpose. I would go back again for its great location!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"David Freitag","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXAq2jjoS0kgPScBuHoQas2qMruxF0n7RutIpinpzY2UQWpA40J=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The price is right! I booked an online deal and was pleasantly surprised by a very spacious and clean room. The front desk was very helpful and friendly and housekeeping stopped by twice to make sure I had fresh towels and sheets. I enjoyed the room so much I extended the stay for 2 extra days and they honored the special pricing for all 3 nights!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Rose2026","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QfnSFWXMd1oJu73a6IhdtgibYcjse2HKQTHeghNQd9Cyw8DYQQJZDCyh-TD68ehXuY-FA=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"I booked a room for 6 nights , on the second night the elevator broke. It was long wait times just to get to the 3rd floor. The level of traffic of people needing the elevator outweighed the long time it took to be fixed.  Next the ice machine on the 3rd level broke. If you simply want ice I had to go to the next section which wasn‚Äôt ocean view. So it was a walk because the machine to service ocean views side never got fixed. During checkout it was still broken. No sign or anything just the top hanging down exposing the grungy dirt under the machine. ||Also housekeeping wait times are hours. I ordered towels around 7:45pm 1/6 and never received them. Called back and they never came .  The wait time seems like 24 hours which is inexcusable when the hotel stay was $417 and the resort fee $309 literal almost the exact price of the stay. The room and service  would expected to be up to par.  The bathroom definitely the tub was dingy looking and needs a revamp. The shower curtain as well as water not staying hot , Ijust feel like it was good I checked it out but with the high resort fee and parking being a Nevada local I‚Äôll do my next staycation elsewhere where I will feel like I got my moneys worth","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"colbox","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0QejddW0yoGeT8LnCjh-OGQgsf6YKqhof3HZA5-um4yCkQej85oCdMUmKPJmnowcu5Ag5w=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"One of the worst hotels I have stayed at. I understand that you cannot expect too much from a cheap place, but this one tool the top price in unbelievably bad in every way!||The first indication I was in trouble, was when the Lyft driver reluctantly unlocked my door to let me out when I arrived. He also knew that I was going to be lucky to survive in one piece. ||I entered the hotel and was told I would need to pay $40 to check on early. When I asked if I could drop my bags instead, they said  they did not offer that service.||The room was a basic as possible. I think some  prison cells might be more comfortable. The noise from the construction of the new baseball park next door, the helicopters flying yo the airport down Tropicana Blvd and  the planes taking off at Las Vegas airport meant there was no piece and quiet!||Hooters was closed down. When I could not access the gym, security told me they were ‚Äúon a job‚Äù with the police. I was not able to access my room and the front desk told me I had not paid they.  resort fee, so they locked me out. It was the same guy who had checked me in the day before, and I reminded him he had not asked for payment of the resort fee. He told me I had to be escorted to my room to pick up my card  with Security. The staff were miserable, the Steak & Shake was horrible and I did not feel safe. The only positive was that Denny‚Äôs was one block away, if you could avoid being mugged. Not a safe neighborhood. I was so happy to leave, and to survive such a terrible experience.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Shanna Katzenberger","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW3hphY-ltKO61RDX8Qew2HeINLdmwvOB46rYMM74aSikSK1-Q=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Do yourself a favor and do not book a room at this hotel.This is not a disgruntled opinion. Everyone was nice enough just not helpful. The room was dirty. The bathroom shower came with the last guest's hair and there was no body wash. The lamps didn't work in the room. There are absolutely no amenities for this hotel. Be prepared to pay extra for a room with a fridge and coffee maker. Be prepared to pay for parking. $40 for 2 days. The ice machine was broken. The snack machine was broken. Some of the elevators were broken. The customer service number is a joke. After calling the number 4 times was I able to get ahold of a person only to be transferred to a line that just keeps ringing. Make sure to read the fine print as there is a resort fee of over $50 for each day of stay. The swimming pool was unavailable due to inclement weather although it was 70 degrees outside. Guest Services doesn't care about the complaints either. They just give you an email address and send you on your way.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Alex Garza","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXNvUGdtE-q2FToxYFLTUj3kAyFs2gGeG4ywQm3OY16COZzOB0=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"There were good, and bad things about this hotel.

We personally did not find the rooms to match the horror stories we had read about. They weren‚Äôt anything special, or dazzling, but they were far from awful.

The front desk staff was always extremely friendly, especially Anthony, who was wonderful working with us as we checked in.

The bad was what unfortunately will cause us not to return.

The bar staff wasn‚Äôt anywhere near as friendly as the front desk. It honestly felt like we were an annoyance to them.

We didn‚Äôt receive any room service all week, even after having called for fresh towels.

The horror stories of the elevators are true. It got so bad our final day trying to get back to my room I elected to walk the stairs 12 floors up, then 12 floors back down when we went to leave.

My final issue isn‚Äôt necessarily OYO‚Äôs fault, but the location makes it a bit of a walk to get anywhere not very south on the Strip.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 3645 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
column18: Established venue with a casino & fine dining, plus 3 bars, an arcade & a seasonal pool.
column31: null
column32:
[{"Name":"jake","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXuAYX7bqK0mhnkP6LSX2pCPn7Nxf7PtC5eYZ1wYyLd88EqESLbmw=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Second time staying here for multiple days at a time during the last 12 months.  Great location. Property is small but rooms look good and are large. Only complaint about the rooms is the Air Conditioning isn't very strong. The fan doesn't blow the air out very powerfully even when set to manual high. And you can only lower the temp to 68 at the lowest which doesn't feel like 68. Both stays it has felt more like 72 degrees and not much air flow which makes it feel humid and sticky. Only savior is the window cracks open about an inch and a half. So if it's cool at night you get a little help from that. Probably has to do with the eco thermostats.

Also night time staff at registration is great. Daytime staff not so great. Don't think I'll be staying here again due to the day staff and air conditioning.

Location is great though. And prices are decent.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"yourstar rating","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXX49TOMhUNGongryRAEpkpYlv2mq0QBwXFijFphuaBja7wwSU=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":3,"Description":"I stayed at this hotel recently, and while the property itself is fine, I want to share an honest concern about staff behavior and inclusivity.
As a brown guest, I felt noticeably overlooked during my stay‚Äîparticularly in the casino and bar areas. Staff frequently passed by without greeting or checking in, and I often had to walk up to the bar myself to request service. A few staff members were courteous, but overall, the attention felt inconsistent and, at times, dismissive.
I‚Äôm sharing this not to accuse, but to be transparent. If this happened to me, it may also be happening to other guests from diverse backgrounds. Every customer deserves the same level of respect and service, regardless of skin color or appearance‚Äîespecially in a place where guests are actively spending money.
Additionally, room cleanliness and basic maintenance need improvement (for example, broken restroom fixtures). These details matter and affect the overall experience.
I hope management views this feedback constructively. Better staff training on customer engagement and inclusivity, along with improved housekeeping standards, would make a significant difference. Guests should feel welcome here‚Äîno exceptions.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Rebecca Barkey","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW6d-WSVArqOMCmi9WmhBx4MPm4YNM6-JeuaxmgULnHXpIh2kt6=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"We loved our stay at Planet Hollywood! The location was great! Lots of good food choices and shopping nearby. All the people were friendly. Room was spacious, clean and quiet with an amazing view!!  I took away one star for the room just because all the pillows are smushy and there isn't very good lighting. Beyond that, our stay was perfect!","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhCgjts-Whg0ap_K_VOqBgkD&fid=0x0:0x6df9db9e3fa590e0"],"When":"2026-2-3"},{"Name":"Paul Miller","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUfv-ZND6NHZ2D6DgZZ0YCc01mDFZZHmn1H-5pzlFcF0xTfe84=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"Location is perfect if you want to be on the strip. Other than that I dont have anything nice to say. Unfortunately this place is a reflection of why this whole area is doing so poorly. They just continue to gouge customers for everything. The bed isnt comfortable. The temperature isnt comfortable. The fridge in our room didnt work so couldnt keep food. 36 bucks for mediocre food for a single person. 20 dollars per day to self park in a garage thats a nightmare to get into and requires a VERY long walk through Paris to even get into the horseshoe. Hotel staff acts annoyed at questions. We learned out lesson. We have family in Henderson and next time we will just get an airbnb or something away from the strip. Its only like 10 minutes to get down there anyway, especially since its not crowded since people stopped going there.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Rob G","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjV5P-ixO2B82cnFQo0jHyZu-tPEE3ZfbxAFed7zFmr6nN1HEto=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Great location right in the middle of the strip, crossing the road from Bellagio and with a connection to Paris.
Renewed rooms, everything was impecable, empty minifrige to use in the room. Great room size. Connection to the Monorial. Plenty food/drink options just in front, at Paris or at the lower level. CVS a few minutes walk away.
Historical site that was the original MGM grand casino and biggest hotel built at that time. Casino floor smells like cigars but that's how it is on many casinos here. You can choose to have or not room service at checkin time. Beds were comfy. Automated checking from machines at front desk. Checkout at easy as filling a survey in an email and dropping your keys at front desk collectors.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhBkbjLloUhzJrl2fQYWrYFU&fid=0x0:0x6df9db9e3fa590e0"],"When":"2026-1-28"},{"Name":"M S","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLOlmiuhvOty4o0-ZmvhoQxD5sHUvyUPpyf1WPo0utn6osEKg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"The receptionist was a machine and i had no real interaction with staff. Room was ok for the price. Location is getting better with the addition of the new restaurants right out front. Entertainment is lacking in the hotel but plenty to find nearby. I would recommend for the price if you're looking for affordability on the strip.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"F. L.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKUrNtkYZEwBavmeujyWcWRvcM0YBYB7_Y63TGJTu660E7ENpM=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"We got a non smoking room on the 10th floor, when we got in the room, we smell a strong smoking, we guessed they used a famous perfume named ‚Äúsmoking‚Äù to welcome you; the room is with a great view which you can see the beautiful street view in the night. With this beautiful view, you can hear the wonderful sounds such as the speeding car, the breaking. and the horning from the street. Moreover, this hotel is so thoughtful, they provided few body lotions for the customers to share, so you will get the ‚Äúused‚Äù and ‚Äúopened‚Äù one from the previous customer in order to save money. On top of that, the water left in the bathtub indicated the cleaned the bathtub very well, cause you can still see the bobbles in the tub, I assumed the use the powerful cleaners to clean it.
Oh. BTW. at the end, when we were getting ready to rest, we saw a hair on the bed under the sheet, what a surprise they prepared for us for the new year vacation
So thank you Horseshoes Hotel for your wonderful service.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Linda Hazard","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJJlqkIsu6zERhRbtX5PZIug_1XMVucl5qn0QscNKN0KiVC7w=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"Great location. Hotel smells great. Very clean. Bed is ok. The room and casino are uncomfortably warm. I was told there was nothing they could do about the temp in the room. We did have a great view of the sphere, but we will choose somewhere else next time. Too hot.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column32:
[{"Name":"Marina Arnold","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKNh0aTAPk87eEUr-w0WwA-vebP0UMkNdMlhDmKBrFHvYdEM7w=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"We checked in at 11 pm, but our two rooms were no longer available, even though we had booked them in advance. The four of us ended up sleeping in one room. The cleanliness left a lot to be desired, as did the staff. Pictures of the shower are attached. There was an insect in the bathroom, a burn hole in the duvet, and a lipstick mark on the bedsheet. We shouldn't have to pay anything for this; it's an absolute disgrace.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"James T. Patterson (Patt)","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUDzi4mXPQlVggIbkb8VMDsSVOXtvXJlaeWij5p9_zrtjGwFTygxQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"The staff was very accommodating in friendly upon check-in. The rooms, however, definitely need some work. The bed was super Rock hard. There was peeling paint in the bathroom, and although the main room door locked, it would not seal completely, allowing a draft to come in. The pool area and courtyard were at least clean and well taken care of. The location of the property was good, just off the strip away from the noise but close enough to walk easily.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Brian Alexander","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKplCGdmkKCOy0qWefk-RTyhlGkLEywBsRYZM1YfJGdNVKjcOA=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I am mortified at the lack of caring or accountability in a matter involving biohazardous materials in the bathroom area. I have observed what appears to be blood drops and splatter on the bathroom floor from an apparent gunshot wound, the blood drops outline what appear to be pellet holes from shotgun pellets. I was getting ready for my day and about to take a shower when I first noticed. I was barefoot on the floor stepping all over what I'm guessing was a crime scene that was not properly cleaned up. I am appalled by the how the managements very dismissive and unapologetic attitude in the matter, both denying that the blood was present or that it even happened when I know for a fact the coroner was here 2 days ago. They sent security to check it out whom immediately was dismissive and insisted I was wrong suggesting the pellet holes were just cigarette burns and that they wouldn't wipe away and then proceeded to use my bath towel and his foot to wipe away one of the "cigarette burns" on the floor. In one swipe the dried blood outlining the pellet holes was removed and remained on the towel and the pellet holes themselves remain stained red. I didn't want to argue the point with the security guy so I went to the desk which he beat me there to warn them I was coming and then proceeded to argue the point that he's not a healthcare professional and could not say definitively wether or not it was blood that he wiped up with my towel. I said that's really inappropriate to argue semantics in the matter and you don't have to be a healthcare professional to identify blood on a floor dried and coagulated or otherwise. The desk person then begins to argue with me like my concern was for the money I paid for the room and it is definitely not, I told her it wasnt the point at all but that exposure to biohazardous materials was and that I was barefoot in there and now have to pursue means to get myself tested or checked out for exposure to that biohazard. The whole thing was extremely inappropriate and I'm both severely offended and concerned for my health and well-being. The staff was rude, ignorant, belligerent, disrespectful, dishonest and the Motel 6 company/brand should be absolutely ashamed.

I'm in the process of reporting health code violations and my exposure to this biohazard and have begun seeking council in the matter because I will be litigious based solely on their poor attitudes,behavior, irresponsibility,lack of accountability, endangerment of my health and appalling "handling" of a danger to peoples health that could have been avoided easily with simple communication and a desire for resolution.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhA0GEUChXT3xuShkTNiw1sb&fid=0x0:0x1e4f1b26de999ef2"],"When":"2025-12-3"},{"Name":"J Killens","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWtEq9gGwlnF1naOQr3w9Jvt6XEvXwaGL52QPmhYz1vtkjqxVJ1=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"Rooms are decent, clean and a great price. The location is excellent, dining and entertainment are within walking distance! Unfortunately my check in process wasn't pleasant, Jessica didn't make me feel welcome instead it felt as if I was a bother to her or "another task". Overall, it's a great affordable hotel. Thanks for the stay!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Ben Preece","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLWP8ZEIq7lUDNNDkqpogcaWh01Thy75R1Fw-t6NpNfXeMr1w=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Great place to stay.
Nothing fancy. Reasonable rates.
10 minutes from the strip by MGM.
A classic motel.
Rooms are clean and quiet large.
If your only there for a few days worth a look.
Free parking too","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Victor Zhang","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJezsCiEXp4rqWoMStf1XHyUgXFLbLlPC9v5ccJaHnhOpovgE36=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I reserved a non-smoking room in advance, but when I checked in, the hotel told me they only had smoking rooms available. This was extremely frustrating since I specifically booked a non-smoking room for comfort and health reasons.

The room had a strong smell of smoke that made it hard to relax or sleep. I felt misled because the hotel should not confirm reservations they can‚Äôt honor. Even though the staff said they had no other options, there was no real effort to fix the situation or offer compensation.

I understand that things happen, but this experience showed poor management and lack of accountability. I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again unless they improve their booking system and ensure guests get the room type they reserved.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Reed Wolfe Wawrzynek","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjU9Bf6dEinmcwbGJA7Utb0te-CIPTkYl4fhHRBe9o_XqdD7gRgR=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"I booked a non-smoking room, but when I got there, they said they had run out of non smoking rooms and gave me a smoking room. The floor of the room was covered with burn marks and the room smelled awful. The table and chairs also didn‚Äôt seem clean. The linens were clean luckily. Despite being right next to the airport, they do not have an airport shuttle.  The room was clearly quite rundown. I would say no matter how good the price seems, it‚Äôs not worth it and stay somewhere else.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"A. P.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocKin5ZKAJpAHnv-MwGOj5hRQeIJgcx21K8Fscjqq_mK3UeI7n0=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Very disappointing stay.
I understand that a motel isn‚Äôt a hotel and doesn‚Äôt need to look new or renovated ‚Äî but it must be clean! Unfortunately, this place was far from it. There was someone‚Äôs hair on a ‚Äúclean‚Äù towel, thick dust on the bathroom shelves, and even clumps of dirt on the ceiling. It‚Äôs unacceptable for any accommodation, let alone one rated with two stars. On top of that, they asked me to pay again at check-in, and I had to show my bank statement to prove I‚Äôd already paid.
I‚Äôm giving one star only because the bed sheets were clean and there were two small bars of soap. Otherwise, this deserves zero.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDsL4OGRAhstAgQ8ejSkZ4m&fid=0x0:0x1e4f1b26de999ef2"],"When":"2025-10-13"}]

Not just in one room but many, loose door lock and the hotel has only been painted enough to take photos from the front for advertising it seems. Burn marks on the mattress. The out of order ice machine that says please dont use your hands in the ice is disturbing. They dont have resort fee and do have free parking. They have corn hole but you have to leave a $20 deposit at the office for the bags. I wouldn't put my mother in this motel but a bachelor party or frat bros would be fine.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Chance","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUlL34FB9c39eDD4qhGkO0zwfSIvsxJHuYRA-_BDcCXe0eOO6q7=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"The photos are NOT FROM THESE ROOMS.
Totally misleading. The keycards to get in only have a 50% chance of working, you have to go back to the office and reset them. Its worth spending a little more somewhere else. One of the worst rooms ive stayed in","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"CJ Ehret","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocIy_1iCL03YAIDvYpK4cCsQcFs_Ap9u8SN9mbX5ZHGphVllUg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"I know people can have off days or be busy, so I'm sure some of the negative reviews are valid, but for $100/night on a Friday night, right on the strip, I couldn't have been more pleased. column32: [{"Name":"Ion Dawn","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUFMBcjN94e1hNa2VYLU-yptDnb1IKJj1r_lDqrI3qn4CXrNOfG=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Great staff, Eric provided great service and had me checked in very easy, and gave me details about the hotel, hotel breakfast and my room! The breakfast is very convenient when you need to chow in the morning or take something on the go, the kitchen and staff was very friendly and the food always came out fresh and hot, it‚Äôs $10 dollars but it‚Äôs worth it! My room was spacious \u0026 comfortable with a work space plus extra furniture to relax, i had a large balcony with a view of the entire pool. Everything was clean and room service was professional! This is a convenient location close to Las Vegas Blvd","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Jon Sage","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjUreJDiCf0JpyMqn9EgjA5GN4IEfUsSnc0pNqX0L9wxYQOpLy0=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I arrived on business in the morning and stopped by the hotel to make sure my reservation was intact for the next few days. Although it was early for normal check-in, Sarah at the front desk pulled up my room, and, seeing it was already available, offered to check me in early so I wouldn't have to carry my luggage around or store it. That, plus having a clean and updated room, along with  a secure property, made the stay phenomenal, and all of it at an extraordinarily reasonable price. I love the Serene Vegas Boutique Hotel and definitely plan to stay again in the future.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Daniel D.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLlqlFV9MxRDkIGqyybJi091ASJ3oNIjxnry8NlglMaC-AWvqQm=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I don't understand the bad reviews! My girl and I stayed here for 2 nights before we head back to Oregon and I must say...WELL WORTH IT!!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Christian Martinez","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW95GIdqs6I-UTBK8xcqeV70z0zOqcfMreBax-VtwofU4D9B88E=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Our stay at the Serene Hotel was made unforgettable thanks to the incredible service provided by Sarah. The rooms were clean, housekeeping came everyday and kept the room spick and span, great staff that accommodated an early check-in for us. Would love to stay here again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"–ï–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –¢. (–õ–µ–Ω–∏)","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjXVISlzEXjfCIOAoRcJJE3_IxqVNhv6GumVEkK5h6qe3HZojkjOPA=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":4,"Description":"The place is lovely, new, fresh and simple. The rooms are big and clean. Good price and nice free and spacious parking. The staff is lovely. You ove 200USD deposit when you go which is refundable. I find it a bit odd to have just 1 microwave in the lobby for all guests but that is how they decided it to be. However a huge no for me was the AC, after I changed the temperature, dust started falling on the bed and I am alergic. It would've been best if they changed the filters of the AC.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 7260 S Las Vegas Blvd Unit #228, Las Vegas, NV 89119
column18: Bright studios & suites with kitchenettes in a low-key lodging offering a pool, a gym & free Wi-Fi.
column31: null
column32:
[{"Name":"Tyree Brown","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVkb_G5N_iXNJjpAf91gw-lRmDhH8pruPKzNKD4I4DQ0aPxdUPILQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba2-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I‚Äôve been living here about three weeks now, and I‚Äôve got to be straight about it, this place surprised me in all the right ways. I came in skeptical, especially with everything you hear about some of the other Siegel spots around town, but this location really operates on a different level.

From day one, Jahon stood out. The property stays clean, the rooms are solid and comfortable, and the convenience is unmatched. Not only is the mall right across the street, but there are several different restaurants in every direction, so day-to-day living is smooth and simple.

But the real difference here is Jahon. The moment I walked through the door, he gave the kind of customer service you don‚Äôt see often in Vegas anymore. Genuine energy, real kindness, knows the area, and makes you feel taken care of without trying too hard. It‚Äôs natural for him.

Jahon brings the kind of energy you can‚Äôt teach, steady, genuine, and real. Folks like that make a place feel safe and welcoming without even trying. I respect that. And honestly, this spot has been a 10 out of 10 for me, no regrets about calling it home.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Michelle Boron","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJEofczablZydiGZlBA9MeFTczmbtLxZLWPSDsT3L43fZjsNg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I stayed at this property from November 27th to November 28th and there are so many amazing things I have to say, my husband and I stayed here, and we were immediately greeted by the wonderful Jahon, who made the entire stay even better than what we initially thought. The room was amazing. The bedroom was clean and really comfortable. The location was amazing as well. The mall is right across the street. Made all of our shopping and wondrous needs met. But I really want to go in deeper about Jahon's customer service. The moment we walked in. We were greeted with the utmost and best customer service we‚Äôve ever seen in all of our time here in Vegas. We had a great chat about places to visit and where we could go. The following day after we were to check out because our flight didn‚Äôt leave until just about four P.M.. He even gave us a late check-out of noon and assisted us with finding a good breakfast place. If you don‚Äôt know already, I‚Äôm telling you now you need to keep him as long as you can. He‚Äôs such a sweet, loving, and caring person, and I hope the world is as nice and sweet to him as he is to everyone else. Everyone who was in the lobby at check-in even commended him for being there on Thanksgiving. But he still had the biggest and greatest smile on his face. 10 out of 10 we would stay at this property again. Hope to see you guys soon thank you for the amazing stay.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Frank W.","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVu2vrrJbcGnJUY4FMfhdXsqJNov0Gl66nPIZBCDp03voUBdBb0=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Been here 3 times and can't say enough good things about this place. The room size is fantastic, front desk was always friendly and everything is very clean. Tracy was always very helpful when I arrived with problem (and Booking.com and Alaska Air made sure I arrived with big problems!). Highly tecommend  to stay if you're looking for an affordable hotel in Vegas! Looking forward on returning next year. ü•≥","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Rose Jackson","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJzIBt83mVFWXOozTN67IfqusFYlCSJkTZuUuA8r2jChzBZAQ=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Room sizes are great, front desk is friendly and Tracy is so kind and accommodating! I was impressed with how clean everything was from the parking lot, lobby, elevator, laundry room!
Location is right off the airport, across the street is the outlet mall and all the great places to eat! Recommend to for everyone to stay here!","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Mathew","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK7yVjypoB9wIzT5W49_sAsSub3gvIQx3aUg4umVIw1K1Qw0Q=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I wish I could give 10 stars to this property amazing comfy rooms amazing staff. Rooms clean. Front desk guy johan was Phenomenal!! He dealt with everyone with so much care and love I felt like I was at home. 10/10 would definitely come again.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Maksim Habets","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWPLvajthoJMtRPvZQDlSJiEJ9c5IBL3A2Mn6XIne1ajvCyNBRW=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":1,"Description":"Avoid, not worth the money and 5/5 reviews does not reflect the actual state of the property.

It was a smell of weed smoke in the halls despite the "no smoking" signs. However, the worst part was the roaches. We had to kill a couple right upon checking into the room. Then we left to explore the city, and upon return, found many more crawling on the food on the shelves and on the suitcase. We decided to leave to avoid bringing them to our home in the suitcase. We also had to throw out all the food that wasn't stored in hermetically sealed containers.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhApLD8rjm7MDWJTNJEp_QvN&fid=0x0:0xb67c0297eadc07d2"],"When":"2026-1-27"},{"Name":"kendrick handy","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocK7JSFWCEssiR7DlGm6LnGTQeVBoL7_UHlyXEqNiCIZ_AVRgg=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Tracy and Jahon are wonderful representatives of this establishment. They are very knowledgeable and answered all my questions. Rooms were also very well maintained and the location is on the best side of town in the valley","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Vincent Dolce","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjURQIuef8JvK96e-RAY1RJm5tlCa6_-TZpWjXp1knFDQSzLmMyx=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. I am moving to Vegas and stayed here waiting for permanent residence. It is wonderful. The staff is great. The rooms were spotless and they really worked very hard to do a good job.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 2600 W Harmon Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89158
column18: Sleek casino-free hotel offering eclectic dining options, an outdoor pool & a luxe spa.
column31: [{"id":"crowd","name":"Crowd","options":[{"name":"LGBTQ+ friendly","enabled":true}]}]
column32:
[{"Name":"M. Fowler","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocLC1za_nqJs1SRX_AW7w-xNezVJF0k0UxWi3b3G4nBEP_rkCQ=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"My first, but definitely not my last time here! I felt like a queen in this 39th floor studio suite, that could easily fit 2 to 4 guests. It was one king bed and a queen sofa couch. I got a great Black Friday deal that included $100 food credit for any MGM owned restaurants nearby. I went to Blossom (awesome Asian restaurant).

I came for my birthday and the New Edition concert that was at the Tmobile Arena, maybe a half mile away. You can see the arena from my 39th floor view!

No, there's not a casino, because this is for pure relaxation, which also has a spa that I also visited. Masseuse Christie and the team were awesome! You're able to take advantage of the spa amenities all day on the day of your paid reservation.

Aria, the sister property and other nearby  hotels, including Park MGM, have casinos within walking distance.

This hotel is also within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile Mall in the Planet Hollywood building. Also near the Crystal's high end shops and the airport.

There's a Starbucks on site, which came in handy. Plus, another small convenient shop/restaurant (24 hrs) and a full bar/restaurant in the lobby.

I look forward to my next visit!","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhDecoQfI3KbEvWvqXTakUzZ&fid=0x0:0x2d6c29d4fa5b4511"],"When":"2026-2-4"},{"Name":"wisgirl01","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/local-reviews/AJMZ0Qcx7DtSIuJI9UJU1ybYoEA6i_uOe_F9V6dOnYVPO8gBdo0k23EJlyGd0YO4_LmJhQZKEQ=s120-c-br100","Rating":0,"Description":"This was my second stay at Vdara, and I used Marriott points for our stay. Overall, it is a solid choice. It is a great location, connected to Bellagio and the Cosmo with a walkway. It is also in the same drop off as the Aria. So you can easily get to casinos, as well as the strip. There is not a casino in the hotel, which was part of the draw. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. We both worked remotely on Friday, and were able to do so easily. There is a great spot for brunch in the lobby, which also has a great bar for a nightcap. There is a well equipped gym, which wasn't too busy when I went.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Lisa Larter","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVrW3MuyWhCollXIiJL9HWclcIbf9T0JZZsGTSTuN5XfAmP1BgO=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"We arrived around noon and our room was not ready. We went the bar where Hugo made us the best spicy margaritas we‚Äôve ever had. After about 5 hours, and being promised a high room (we booked a suite) our room was ready. When we arrived, we were shocked at how filthy it was.

We immediately went downstairs to complain, tweeted about it several times, and while the operations manager gave us a $150 restaurant credit, the next room wasn‚Äôt much better. Thus hotel is very tired and very dirty. I would not stay here again and would have preferred to pay the full amount and stay in a clean room.

The servers in the main bar area were great, (5 star!) super friendly and helpful, especially Hugo, Jo and Joana. Joana actually remembered our names which I can‚Äôt imagine is easy to do with so many guests.

The room situation though was very disappointing. We‚Äôve stayed at the Bellagio and the Aria and never experienced the filth we saw at the Vdara. To be honest, I tried unsuccessfully to book us someplace else - it was that bad.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhAChEAJVcixh-1SelEYE425&fid=0x0:0x2d6c29d4fa5b4511"],"When":"2026-2-8"},{"Name":"Will","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjVSlpwPrA2T-7dd5sxL5qAAKVcmDLqNeIgfirg-qj4Hhavolf-E=s120-c-rp-mo-ba5-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Stayed for 4 nights at the Vdara late January and have no complaints. Room was very clean upon our arrival, bed was comfy, and staff were very friendly and accommodating. Hotel is also easy to navigate which is a bonus in a city full of large, maze-like hotels.
Location is pretty good being next to the Aria, Cosmopolitan, and Bellagio though do expect to spend some time walking to get places, but that's all of Vegas, basically.
Definitely recommend staying here.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhD-GQ76XWKedXkIlNot20KO&fid=0x0:0x2d6c29d4fa5b4511"],"When":"2026-2-12"},{"Name":"Saleh Al Sayed (S M Al Sayed)","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWZUdsI_HoE2lAWehRcvuTsuXhRgl2tsIOBysW4NaQkbSBHmpUfwg=s120-c-rp-mo-ba4-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"The best hotel I‚Äôve stayed at  Las Vegas so far. No casino, no cigars‚Äîjust a healthy, peaceful atmosphere. Friendly staff, excellent cleanliness, spacious rooms with a beautiful view, and delicious room service food. Check-in and check-out  fast and easy, and everything in the room can be controlled through the iPad. Truly my favorite hotel.","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Truthful","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a/ACg8ocJUjeyhp4eNaX_GlBS8XkuTraf_dXWCrX5sVp48RBSRWC4dUYw=s120-c-rp-mo-ba3-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Surprise welcoming when you walk in your room; drapes open automatically and lights on. Clean hallways, clean rooms, refrigirator, microwave, stove top and sofa beds in every room one to two TVs  Conveniently located, 24 hr service (cleaning, amenities, or if you forgot something and they have it) if needed. And there's an Aria tram so you dont have to walk so much, takes you to specific stops but can bring you back close to your room. Aria and Vdara are sister hotels Aria is the larger one Vdara is nestled by Aria (one building) Vdara has some owners/time share holders for this specific hotel. Staying at Vdara, you won't be disappointed","Images":null,"When":""},{"Name":"Carl Wong","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjWzzzCEbFywrfN6J8D1cg9gzfF5k6W__avTERzLSOylhZ2b_2N4=s120-c-rp-mo-ba6-br100","Rating":5,"Description":"Vdara is strategically located at the City Center adjacent to Aria, Crystal Shops, The Cosmopolitan and Waldorf Astoria. It's also connected to Park MGM and Bellagio via walkways. Although it's at the hub of the Strip, it's actually away from Las Vegas Blvd hence less traffic noise from the room.

A portion of the rooms are actually individually owned but managed by MGM. Unit 16032 has great views of the Sphere among other things. It's close to the elevators so there's more noise from the foot traffic but tolerable. The studio layout conveniently separates the entrance with a dining table and kitchenette, a sitting area and the sleeping quarter and the bathroom. It is a good balance between a hotel and an apartment. There's no casino, which is another plus although Aria is just a short walk away with all the actions and restaurants. The best part is you could go to any MGM Resorts' restaurants and charged it to the room.

The marketplace on the first floor serves beverages, sandwiches and pastries. There's also Starbucks and a bar lounge. Cleaning is not included for the stay but is available at a fee and additional towels, robes or kitchenware can be requested through housekeeping. Another advantage is the fact that valet parking is complementary (please tip the attendant), and there's no resort fees, saving $70+ per night.","Images":["www.google.com/local/imagery/report/?cb_client=maps_sv.tactile&image_key=!1e10!2sCIABIhCVoiAo7MJRAxKNLF2JVSJB&fid=0x0:0x2d6c29d4fa5b4511"],"When":"2026-1-8"},{"Name":"Donna PetersonF","ProfilePicture":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/a-/ALV-UjW9BqP54Wd6i0LDywBTn5RnAEmjiOjstdrzR9L0pVtDaMygLFOy=s120-c-rp-mo-br100","Rating":2,"Description":"Seems like this hotel can‚Äôt figure how much they want to charge their guests. Yes they nickel and dime you. & their parking is far and it‚Äôs not on the strip.
1. Whatever the Hotel rate is
2. Fee for Parking which they own
3. $16 in room coffee for maker, $22 gummies and alcohol.
4. Resort fee- $55 which only covers a pool ,when open ant Aria(  ice room was closed .
5. Many taxes

Rooms are a nice size. & look nice.","Images":null,"When":""}]

column5: 511 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101
column18: Stone-faced bar with real fireplaces, an eclectic jukebox & dim back room featuring weekend DJs.
